### Import Statement

```python
from openbb_core.provider.standard_models.port_info import (
PortInfoData,
PortInfoQueryParams,
)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='imf' label='imf'>

**continent**: `Literal['north_america', 'europe', 'asia_pacific', 'south_america', 'africa']`<br/>
Filter by continent. This parameter is ignored when a `country` is provided.

**country**: `Literal['ABW', 'AGO', 'AIA', 'ALB', 'ARE', 'ARG', 'ASM', 'ATG', 'AUS', 'AZE', 'BEL', 'BEN', 'BES', 'BGD', 'BGR', 'BHR', 'BHS', 'BLM', 'BLZ', 'BRA', 'BRB', 'BRN', 'CAN', 'CHL', 'CHN', 'CIV', 'CMR', 'COD', 'COG', 'COK', 'COL', 'COM', 'CPV', 'CRI', 'CUB', 'CUW', 'CYM', 'CYP', 'DEU', 'DJI', 'DMA', 'DNK', 'DOM', 'DZA', 'ECU', 'EGY', 'ERI', 'ESP', 'EST', 'FIN', 'FJI', 'FRA', 'FRO', 'FSM', 'GAB', 'GBR', 'GEO', 'GHA', 'GIB', 'GIN', 'GLP', 'GMB', 'GNB', 'GNQ', 'GRC', 'GRD', 'GTM', 'GUF', 'GUM', 'GUY', 'HKG', 'HND', 'HRV', 'HTI', 'IDN', 'IND', 'IRL', 'IRN', 'IRQ', 'ISL', 'ISR', 'ITA', 'JAM', 'JOR', 'JPN', 'KAZ', 'KEN', 'KHM', 'KIR', 'KNA', 'KOR', 'KWT', 'LBN', 'LBR', 'LBY', 'LCA', 'LKA', 'LTU', 'LVA', 'MAC', 'MAF', 'MAR', 'MDA', 'MDG', 'MDV', 'MEX', 'MHL', 'MLT', 'MMR', 'MNE', 'MNP', 'MOZ', 'MRT', 'MSR', 'MTQ', 'MUS', 'MYS', 'MYT', 'NAM', 'NCL', 'NGA', 'NIC', 'NLD', 'NOR', 'NRU', 'NZL', 'OMN', 'PAK', 'PAN', 'PER', 'PHL', 'PLW', 'PNG', 'POL', 'PRI', 'PRT', 'PYF', 'QAT', 'REU', 'ROU', 'RUS', 'SAU', 'SDN', 'SEN', 'SGP', 'SLB', 'SLE', 'SLV', 'SOM', 'STP', 'SUR', 'SVN', 'SWE', 'SXM', 'SYC', 'SYR', 'TCA', 'TGO', 'THA', 'TKM', 'TLS', 'TON', 'TTO', 'TUN', 'TUR', 'TUV', 'TWN', 'TZA', 'UKR', 'URY', 'USA', 'VCT', 'VEN', 'VGB', 'VIR', 'VNM', 'VUT', 'WSM', 'YEM', 'ZAF']`<br/>
Country to focus on. Enter as a 3-letter ISO country code. This parameter supersedes `continent` if both are provided.

**limit**: `int`<br/>
Limit the number of results returned. Limit is determined by the annual average number of vessels transiting through the port. If not provided, all ports are returned.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**port_code**: `str`<br/>
Unique ID assigned to the port by the source.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='imf' label='imf'>

**port_code**: `str`<br/>
Unique ID assigned to the port.

**continent**: `str`<br/>
Continent where the port is located.

**country**: `str`<br/>
Country where the port is located.

**country_code**: `str`<br/>
3-letter ISO code of the country where the port is located.

**port_name**: `str`<br/>
Port name.

**port_full_name**: `str`<br/>
Full name of the port.

**latitude**: `float`<br/>
Latitude of the port.

**longitude**: `float`<br/>
Longitude of the port.

**vessel_count_total**: `int`<br/>
Yearly average number of all ships transiting through the port. Estimated using AIS data beginning 2019. The total is calculated over the sum of vessel_count_container, vessel_count_dry_bulk, vessel_count_general_cargo, vessel_count_roro and vessel_count_tanker.

**vessel_count_tanker**: `int`<br/>
Yearly average number of tankers transiting through the port. Estimated using AIS data beginning 2019.

**vessel_count_container**: `int`<br/>
Yearly average number of containers transiting through the port. Estimated using AIS data beginning 2019.

**vessel_count_general_cargo**: `int`<br/>
Yearly average number of general cargo ships transiting through the port. Estimated using AIS data beginning 2019.

**vessel_count_dry_bulk**: `int`<br/>
Yearly average number of dry bulk carriers transiting through the port. Estimated using AIS data beginning 2019.

**vessel_count_roro**: `int`<br/>
Yearly average number of Ro-Ro ships transiting through the port. Estimated using AIS data beginning 2019.

**industry_top1**: `str`<br/>
First dominant traded industries based on the volume of goods estimated to flow through the port.

**industry_top2**: `str`<br/>
Second dominant traded industries based on the volume of goods estimated to flow through the port.

**industry_top3**: `str`<br/>
Third dominant traded industries based on the volume of goods estimated to flow through the port.

**share_country_maritime_import**: `float`<br/>
Share of the total maritime imports of the country that are estimated to flow through the port.

**share_country_maritime_export**: `float`<br/>
Share of the total maritime exports of the country that are estimated to flow through the port.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>



---

---
title: "Port Volume"
description: "Daily port calls and estimates of trading volumes for ports around the world"
---

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

---

## Implementation details

### Class names

| Model name | Parameters class | Data class |
| ---------- | ---------------- | ---------- |
| `PortVolume` | `PortVolumeQueryParams` | `PortVolumeData` |

### Import Statement

```python
from openbb_core.provider.standard_models.port_volume import (
PortVolumeData,
PortVolumeQueryParams,
)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**start_date**: `date`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='econdb' label='econdb'>

**start_date**: `date`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='imf' label='imf'>

**start_date**: `date`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**port_code**: `str | list[str]`<br/>
Port code to filter results by a specific port. This parameter is ignored if `country` parameter is provided. To get a list of available ports, use `obb.economy.shipping.port_info()`. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): imf.

**country**: `Literal['ABW', 'AGO', 'AIA', 'ALB', 'ARE', 'ARG', 'ASM', 'ATG', 'AUS', 'AZE', 'BEL', 'BEN', 'BES', 'BGD', 'BGR', 'BHR', 'BHS', 'BLM', 'BLZ', 'BRA', 'BRB', 'BRN', 'CAN', 'CHL', 'CHN', 'CIV', 'CMR', 'COD', 'COG', 'COK', 'COL', 'COM', 'CPV', 'CRI', 'CUB', 'CUW', 'CYM', 'CYP', 'DEU', 'DJI', 'DMA', 'DNK', 'DOM', 'DZA', 'ECU', 'EGY', 'ERI', 'ESP', 'EST', 'FIN', 'FJI', 'FRA', 'FRO', 'FSM', 'GAB', 'GBR', 'GEO', 'GHA', 'GIB', 'GIN', 'GLP', 'GMB', 'GNB', 'GNQ', 'GRC', 'GRD', 'GTM', 'GUF', 'GUM', 'GUY', 'HKG', 'HND', 'HRV', 'HTI', 'IDN', 'IND', 'IRL', 'IRN', 'IRQ', 'ISL', 'ISR', 'ITA', 'JAM', 'JOR', 'JPN', 'KAZ', 'KEN', 'KHM', 'KIR', 'KNA', 'KOR', 'KWT', 'LBN', 'LBR', 'LBY', 'LCA', 'LKA', 'LTU', 'LVA', 'MAC', 'MAF', 'MAR', 'MDA', 'MDG', 'MDV', 'MEX', 'MHL', 'MLT', 'MMR', 'MNE', 'MNP', 'MOZ', 'MRT', 'MSR', 'MTQ', 'MUS', 'MYS', 'MYT', 'NAM', 'NCL', 'NGA', 'NIC', 'NLD', 'NOR', 'NRU', 'NZL', 'OMN', 'PAK', 'PAN', 'PER', 'PHL', 'PLW', 'PNG', 'POL', 'PRI', 'PRT', 'PYF', 'QAT', 'REU', 'ROU', 'RUS', 'SAU', 'SDN', 'SEN', 'SGP', 'SLB', 'SLE', 'SLV', 'SOM', 'STP', 'SUR', 'SVN', 'SWE', 'SXM', 'SYC', 'SYR', 'TCA', 'TGO', 'THA', 'TKM', 'TLS', 'TON', 'TTO', 'TUN', 'TUR', 'TUV', 'TWN', 'TZA', 'UKR', 'URY', 'USA', 'VCT', 'VEN', 'VGB', 'VIR', 'VNM', 'VUT', 'WSM', 'YEM', 'ZAF']`<br/>
Country to focus on. Enter as a 3-letter ISO country code. This parameter is overridden by `port_code` if both are provided.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**port_code**: `str`<br/>
Port code.

**port_name**: `str`<br/>
Port name.

**country**: `str`<br/>
Country where the port is located.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='econdb' label='econdb'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**port_code**: `str`<br/>
Port code.

**port_name**: `str`<br/>
Port name.

**country**: `str`<br/>
Country where the port is located.

**export_dwell_time**: `float`<br/>
EconDB model estimate for the average number of days from when a container enters the terminal gates until it is loaded on a vessel. High dwelling times can indicate vessel delays.

**import_dwell_time**: `float`<br/>
EconDB model estimate for the average number of days from when a container is discharged from a vessel until it exits the terminal gates. High dwelling times can indicate trucking or port congestion.

**import_teu**: `int`<br/>
EconDB model estimate for the number of twenty-foot equivalent units (TEUs) of containers imported through the port.

**export_teu**: `int`<br/>
EconDB model estimate for the number of twenty-foot equivalent units (TEUs) of containers exported through the port.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='imf' label='imf'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**port_code**: `str`<br/>
Port code.

**port_name**: `str`<br/>
Port name.

**country**: `str`<br/>
Country where the port is located.

**country_code**: `str`<br/>
3-letter ISO country code of the country where the port is located.

**portcalls**: `int`<br/>
Total number of ships entering the port at this date. This is the sum of portcalls_container, portcalls_dry_bulk, portcalls_general_cargo, portcalls_roro and portcalls_tanker.

**portcalls_tanker**: `int`<br/>
Number of tankers transiting through the chokepoint or making a port call.

**portcalls_container**: `int`<br/>
Number of containers transiting through the chokepoint or making a port call.

**portcalls_general_cargo**: `int`<br/>
Number of general cargo ships transiting through the chokepoint or making a port call.

**portcalls_dry_bulk**: `int`<br/>
Number of dry bulk carriers transiting through the chokepoint or making a port call.

**portcalls_roro**: `int`<br/>
Number of Ro-Ro ships transiting through the chokepoint or making a port call.

**imports**: `float`<br/>
Total import volume (in metric tons) of all ships entering the port at this date. This is the sum of import_container, import_dry_bulk, import_general_cargo, import_roro and import_tanker.

**imports_cargo**: `float`<br/>
Total import volume (in metric tons) of all ships (excluding tankers) entering the port at this date. This is the sum of import_container, import_dry_bulk, import_general_cargo and import_roro.

**imports_tanker**: `float`<br/>
Total import volume (in metric tons) of tankers entering the port at this date.

**imports_container**: `float`<br/>
Total import volume (in metric tons) of all container ships entering the port at this date.

**imports_general_cargo**: `float`<br/>
Total import volume (in metric tons) of general cargo ships entering the port at this date.

**imports_dry_bulk**: `float`<br/>
Total import volume (in metric tons) of dry bulk carriers entering the port at this date.

**imports_roro**: `float`<br/>
Total import volume (in metric tons) of Ro-Ro ships entering the port at this date.

**exports**: `float`<br/>
Total export volume (in metric tons) of all ships entering the port at this date. This is the sum of export_container, export_dry_bulk, export_general_cargo, export_roro and export_tanker.

**exports_cargo**: `float`<br/>
Total export volume (in metric tons) of all ships (excluding tankers) entering the port at this date. This is the sum of export_container, export_dry_bulk, export_general_cargo and export_roro.

**exports_tanker**: `float`<br/>
Total export volume (in metric tons) of tankers entering the port at this date.

**exports_container**: `float`<br/>
Total export volume (in metric tons) of all container ships entering the port at this date.

**exports_general_cargo**: `float`<br/>
Total export volume (in metric tons) of general cargo ships entering the port at this date.

**exports_dry_bulk**: `float`<br/>
Total export volume (in metric tons) of dry bulk carriers entering the port at this date.

**exports_roro**: `float`<br/>
Total export volume (in metric tons) of Ro-Ro ships entering the port at this date.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>



---

title: "Price Target"
description: "Get analyst price targets by company"
---

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

---

## Implementation details

### Class names

| Model name | Parameters class | Data class |
| ---------- | ---------------- | ---------- |
| `PriceTarget` | `PriceTargetQueryParams` | `PriceTargetData` |

### Import Statement

```python
from openbb_core.provider.standard_models.price_target import (
PriceTargetData,
PriceTargetQueryParams,
)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**symbol**: `str | list[str]`<br/>
Symbol to get data for. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): benzinga, finviz, fmp.

**limit**: `int`<br/>
The number of data entries to return.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='benzinga' label='benzinga'>

**symbol**: `str | list[str]`<br/>
Symbol to get data for. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): benzinga, finviz, fmp.

**limit**: `int`<br/>
The number of data entries to return.

**page**: `int`<br/>
*Default:* 0<br/>
Page offset. For optimization, performance and technical reasons, page offsets are limited from 0 - 100000. Limit the query results by other parameters such as date. Used in conjunction with the limit and date parameters.

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
Date for calendar data, shorthand for date_from and date_to.

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**updated**: `Union[date, int]`<br/>
Records last Updated Unix timestamp (UTC). This will force the sort order to be Greater Than or Equal to the timestamp indicated. The date can be a date string or a Unix timestamp. The date string must be in the format of YYYY-MM-DD.

**importance**: `int`<br/>
Importance level to filter by. Uses Greater Than or Equal To the importance indicated

**action**: `Literal['downgrades', 'maintains', 'reinstates', 'reiterates', 'upgrades', 'assumes', 'initiates', 'terminates', 'removes', 'suspends', 'firm_dissolved']`<br/>
Filter by a specific action_company.

**analyst_ids**: `Union[str | list[str], list[str | list[str]]]`<br/>
Comma-separated list of analyst (person) IDs. Omitting will bring back all available analysts. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): benzinga.

**firm_ids**: `Union[str | list[str], list[str | list[str]]]`<br/>
Comma-separated list of firm IDs. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): benzinga.

**fields**: `Union[str | list[str], list[str | list[str]]]`<br/>
Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response. See https://docs.benzinga.io/benzinga-apis/calendar/get-ratings to learn about the available fields. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): benzinga.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='finviz' label='finviz'>

**symbol**: `str | list[str]`<br/>
Symbol to get data for. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): benzinga, finviz, fmp.

**limit**: `int`<br/>
The number of data entries to return.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fmp' label='fmp'>

**symbol**: `str | list[str]`<br/>
Symbol to get data for. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): benzinga, finviz, fmp.

**limit**: `int`<br/>
The number of data entries to return.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

Exchange where the company is traded.

Name of company that is the subject of rating.

Analyst name.

**analyst_firm**: `str`<br/>
Name of the analyst firm that published the price target.

Currency the data is denominated in.

The current price target.

Adjusted price target for splits and stock dividends.

</TabItem>

Description of the change in price target from firm's last price target.

**symbol**: `str`<br/>
Symbol representing the entity requested in the data.

**name**: `str`<br/>
The company name

**target_high**: `float`<br/>
High target of the price target consensus.

**target_low**: `float`<br/>
Low target of the price target consensus.

**target_consensus**: `float`<br/>
Consensus target of the price target consensus.

**target_median**: `float`<br/>
Median target of the price target consensus.

**target_upside**: `float`<br/>
Percent of upside, as a normalized percent.

**total_analysts**: `int`<br/>
Total number of analyst.

**buy_ratings**: `int`<br/>
Number of buy ratings.

**sell_ratings**: `int`<br/>
Number of sell ratings.

**hold_ratings**: `int`<br/>
Number of hold ratings.

**consensus_action**: `str`<br/>
Consensus action.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='yfinance' label='yfinance'>

**symbol**: `str`<br/>
Symbol representing the entity requested in the data.

**name**: `str`<br/>
The company name

**target_high**: `float`<br/>
High target of the price target consensus.

**target_low**: `float`<br/>
Low target of the price target consensus.

**target_consensus**: `float`<br/>
Consensus target of the price target consensus.

**target_median**: `float`<br/>
Median target of the price target consensus.

**recommendation**: `str`<br/>
Recommendation - buy, sell, etc.

**recommendation_mean**: `float`<br/>
Mean recommendation score where 1 is strong buy and 5 is strong sell.

**number_of_analysts**: `int`<br/>
Number of analysts providing opinions.

**current_price**: `float`<br/>
Current price of the stock.

**currency**: `str`<br/>
Currency the stock is priced in.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**asset_class**: `Literal['all', 'treasuries', 'tips', 'agency', 'mbs', 'corporate']`<br/>
*Default:* all<br/>
Asset class to return, default is 'all'.

**unit**: `Literal['value', 'percent']`<br/>
*Default:* value<br/>
Unit of the data returned to the 'value' field. Default is 'value', which represents millions of USD. 'percent' returns data as the percentage of the total fails-to-receive and fails-to-deliver, by asset class.

</TabItem>

title: "Reported Financials"

---

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

---

## Implementation details

### Class names

| Model name | Parameters class | Data class |
| ---------- | ---------------- | ---------- |
| `ReportedFinancials` | `ReportedFinancialsQueryParams` | `ReportedFinancialsData` |

### Import Statement

```python
from openbb_core.provider.standard_models.reported_financials import (
ReportedFinancialsData,
ReportedFinancialsQueryParams,
)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**symbol**: `str`<br/>
Symbol to get data for.

**period**: `str`<br/>
*Default:* annual<br/>
Time period of the data to return.

**statement_type**: `str`<br/>
*Default:* balance<br/>
The type of financial statement - i.e, balance, income, cash.

**limit**: `int`<br/>
*Default:* 100<br/>
The number of data entries to return. Although the response object contains multiple results, because of the variance in the fields, year-to-year and quarter-to-quarter, it is recommended to view results in small chunks.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='intrinio' label='intrinio'>

**symbol**: `str`<br/>
Symbol to get data for.

**period**: `Literal['annual', 'quarter']`<br/>
*Default:* annual<br/>
None

**statement_type**: `Literal['balance', 'income', 'cash']`<br/>
*Default:* income<br/>
Cash flow statements are reported as YTD, Q4 is the same as FY.

**limit**: `int`<br/>
*Default:* 100<br/>
The number of data entries to return. Although the response object contains multiple results, because of the variance in the fields, year-to-year and quarter-to-quarter, it is recommended to view results in small chunks.

**fiscal_year**: `int`<br/>
The specific fiscal year.  Reports do not go beyond 2008.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**period_ending**: `date`<br/>
The ending date of the reporting period.

**fiscal_period**: `str`<br/>
The fiscal period of the report (e.g. FY, Q1, etc.).

**fiscal_year**: `int`<br/>
The fiscal year of the fiscal period.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='intrinio' label='intrinio'>

**period_ending**: `date`<br/>
The ending date of the reporting period.

**fiscal_period**: `str`<br/>
The fiscal period of the report (e.g. FY, Q1, etc.).

**fiscal_year**: `int`<br/>
The fiscal year of the fiscal period.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**item**: `str`<br/>
The item or basket of items to query.

**country**: `str`<br/>
*Default:* united_states<br/>
The country to get data.

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**item**: `Literal['beverages', 'cereals', 'dairy', 'fuel', 'produce', 'meats', 'bacon', 'bananas', 'beans', 'beef', 'beer', 'bread', 'butter', 'cheese', 'chicken', 'chops', 'coffee', 'cookies', 'corn', 'diesel', 'eggs', 'electricity', 'flour', 'gas', 'gasoline', 'grapefruit', 'ground_beef', 'ham', 'ice_cream', 'lemons', 'lettuce', 'malt_beverages', 'milk', 'oil', 'orange_juice', 'oranges', 'pork', 'potato_chips', 'potatoes', 'rice', 'soft_drinks', 'spaghetti', 'steak', 'strawberries', 'sugar', 'tomatoes', 'unleaded', 'usda', 'vodka', 'wine', 'yogurt']`<br/>
*Default:* fuel<br/>
The item or basket of items to query.

**country**: `Literal['united_states']`<br/>
*Default:* united_states<br/>
The country to get data.

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**region**: `Literal['all_city', 'northeast', 'midwest', 'south', 'west']`<br/>
*Default:* all_city<br/>
The region to get average price levels for.

**frequency**: `Literal['annual', 'quarter', 'monthly']`<br/>
*Default:* monthly<br/>
The frequency of the data.

**transform**: `Literal['chg', 'ch1', 'pch', 'pc1', 'pca', 'cch', 'cca', 'log']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

Transformation type<br/>
            None = No transformation<br/>
            chg = Change<br/>
            ch1 = Change from Year Ago<br/>
            pch = Percent Change<br/>
            pc1 = Percent Change from Year Ago<br/>
            pca = Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
            cch = Continuously Compounded Rate of Change<br/>
            cca = Continuously Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
            log = Natural Log<br/>
</details>

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

Price, or change in price, per unit.

---
title: "SOFR"
description: "Secured Overnight Financing Rate"
---

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

---

## Implementation details

### Class names

| Model name | Parameters class | Data class |
| ---------- | ---------------- | ---------- |
| `SOFR` | `SOFRQueryParams` | `SOFRData` |

### Import Statement

```python
from openbb_core.provider.standard_models.sofr import (
SOFRData,
SOFRQueryParams,
)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='federal_reserve' label='federal_reserve'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**frequency**: `Literal['a', 'q', 'm', 'w', 'wef', 'weth', 'wew', 'wetu', 'wem', 'wesu', 'wesa', 'bwew', 'bwem']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

Frequency aggregation to convert daily data to lower frequency.<br/>
            a = Annual<br/>
            q = Quarterly<br/>
            m = Monthly<br/>
            w = Weekly<br/>
            wef = Weekly, Ending Friday<br/>
            weth = Weekly, Ending Thursday<br/>
            wew = Weekly, Ending Wednesday<br/>
            wetu = Weekly, Ending Tuesday<br/>
            wem = Weekly, Ending Monday<br/>
            wesu = Weekly, Ending Sunday<br/>
            wesa = Weekly, Ending Saturday<br/>
            bwew = Biweekly, Ending Wednesday<br/>
            bwem = Biweekly, Ending Monday<br/>
</details>

**aggregation_method**: `Literal['avg', 'sum', 'eop']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

A key that indicates the aggregation method used for frequency aggregation.<br/>
            avg = Average<br/>
            sum = Sum<br/>
            eop = End of Period<br/>
</details>

**transform**: `Literal['chg', 'ch1', 'pch', 'pc1', 'pca', 'cch', 'cca', 'log']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

Transformation type<br/>
            None = No transformation<br/>
            chg = Change<br/>
            ch1 = Change from Year Ago<br/>
            pch = Percent Change<br/>
            pc1 = Percent Change from Year Ago<br/>
            pca = Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
            cch = Continuously Compounded Rate of Change<br/>
            cca = Continuously Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
            log = Natural Log<br/>
</details>

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**rate**: `float`<br/>
Effective federal funds rate.

**percentile_1**: `float`<br/>
1st percentile of the distribution.

**percentile_25**: `float`<br/>
25th percentile of the distribution.

**percentile_75**: `float`<br/>
75th percentile of the distribution.

**percentile_99**: `float`<br/>
99th percentile of the distribution.

**volume**: `float`<br/>
The trading volume.The notional volume of transactions (Billions of $).

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='federal_reserve' label='federal_reserve'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**rate**: `float`<br/>
Effective federal funds rate.

**percentile_1**: `float`<br/>
1st percentile of the distribution.

**percentile_25**: `float`<br/>
25th percentile of the distribution.

**percentile_75**: `float`<br/>
75th percentile of the distribution.

**percentile_99**: `float`<br/>
99th percentile of the distribution.

**volume**: `float`<br/>
The trading volume.The notional volume of transactions (Billions of $).

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**rate**: `float`<br/>
Effective federal funds rate.

**percentile_1**: `float`<br/>
1st percentile of the distribution.

**percentile_25**: `float`<br/>
25th percentile of the distribution.

**percentile_75**: `float`<br/>
75th percentile of the distribution.

**percentile_99**: `float`<br/>
99th percentile of the distribution.

**volume**: `float`<br/>
The trading volume.The notional volume of transactions (Billions of $).

**average_30d**: `float`<br/>
30-Day Average SOFR

**average_90d**: `float`<br/>
90-Day Average SOFR

**average_180d**: `float`<br/>
180-Day Average SOFR

**index**: `float`<br/>
SOFR index as 2018-04-02 = 1

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

title: "Sonia"

---

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

---

## Implementation details

### Class names

| Model name | Parameters class | Data class |
| ---------- | ---------------- | ---------- |

### Import Statement

```python
from openbb_core.provider.standard_models.sonia_rates import (
SONIAData,
SONIAQueryParams,
)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**parameter**: `Literal['rate', 'index', '10th_percentile', '25th_percentile', '75th_percentile', '90th_percentile', 'total_nominal_value']`<br/>
*Default:* rate<br/>

</TabItem>

---
title: "Sec Filing"
description: "Download the index headers, and cover page if available, for any SEC filing"
---

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

---

## Implementation details

### Class names

| Model name | Parameters class | Data class |
| ---------- | ---------------- | ---------- |
| `SecFiling` | `SecFilingQueryParams` | `SecFilingData` |

### Import Statement

```python
from openbb_core.provider.standard_models. import (
SecFilingData,
SecFilingQueryParams,
)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='sec' label='sec'>

**url**: `str`<br/>
URL for the SEC filing. The specific URL is not directly used or downloaded, but is used to generate the base URL for the filing. e.g. https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/317540/000031754024000045/coke-20240731.htm and https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/317540/000031754024000045/ are both valid URLs for the same filing.

**use_cache**: `bool`<br/>
*Default:* True<br/>
Use cache for the index headers and cover page. Default is True.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='sec' label='sec'>

**base_url**: `str`<br/>
Base URL of the filing.

**name**: `str`<br/>
Name of the entity filing.

**cik**: `str`<br/>
Central Index Key.

**trading_symbols**: `list`<br/>
Trading symbols, if available.

**sic**: `str`<br/>
Standard Industrial Classification.

**sic_organization_name**: `str`<br/>
SIC Organization Name.

**filing_date**: `date`<br/>
Filing date.

**period_ending**: `date`<br/>
Date of the ending period for the filing, if available.

**fiscal_year_end**: `str`<br/>
Fiscal year end of the entity, if available. Format: MM-DD

**document_type**: `str`<br/>
Specific SEC filing type.

**has_cover_page**: `bool`<br/>
True if the filing has a cover page.

**description**: `str`<br/>
Description of attached content, mostly applicable to 8-K filings.

**cover_page**: `dict`<br/>
Cover page information, if available.

**document_urls**: `list`<br/>
list of files associated with the filing.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>



---

title: "Senior Loan Officer Survey"

---

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

---

## Implementation details

### Class names

| Model name | Parameters class | Data class |
| ---------- | ---------------- | ---------- |

### Import Statement

```python
from openbb_core.provider.standard_models.senior_loan_officer_survey import (
SeniorLoanOfficerSurveyData,
SeniorLoanOfficerSurveyQueryParams,
)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**category**: `Literal['spreads', 'consumer', 'auto', 'credit_card', 'firms', 'mortgage', 'commercial_real_estate', 'standards', 'demand', 'foreign_banks']`<br/>
*Default:* spreads<br/>
Category of survey response.

**transform**: `Literal['chg', 'ch1', 'pch', 'pc1', 'pca', 'cch', 'cca', 'log']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

Transformation type<br/>
            None = No transformation<br/>
            chg = Change<br/>
            ch1 = Change from Year Ago<br/>
            pch = Percent Change<br/>
            pc1 = Percent Change from Year Ago<br/>
            pca = Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
            cch = Continuously Compounded Rate of Change<br/>
            cca = Continuously Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
            log = Natural Log<br/>
</details>

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**symbol**: `str`<br/>
Symbol representing the entity requested in the data.

**value**: `float`<br/>
Survey value.

**title**: `str`<br/>
Survey title.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**symbol**: `str`<br/>
Symbol representing the entity requested in the data.

**value**: `float`<br/>
Survey value.

**title**: `str`<br/>
Survey title.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

**outstanding_shares**: `Union[float, int]`<br/>

The date of the data.

**free_float**: `float`<br/>
Percentage of unrestricted shares of a publicly-traded company.

**float_shares**: `Union[float, int]`<br/>
Number of shares available for trading by the general public.

**outstanding_shares**: `Union[float, int]`<br/>
Total number of shares of a publicly-traded company.

**adjusted_outstanding_shares**: `float`<br/>
Total number of shares of a publicly-traded company, adjusted for splits.

**public_float**: `float`<br/>
Aggregate market value of the shares of a publicly-traded company.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='yfinance' label='yfinance'>

**symbol**: `str`<br/>
Symbol representing the entity requested in the data.

**date**: `Union[Union[date, datetime], str]`<br/>
The date of the data.

**free_float**: `float`<br/>
Percentage of unrestricted shares of a publicly-traded company.

**float_shares**: `Union[float, int]`<br/>
Number of shares available for trading by the general public.

**outstanding_shares**: `Union[float, int]`<br/>
Total number of shares of a publicly-traded company.

**implied_shares_outstanding**: `int`<br/>
Implied Shares Outstanding of common equity, assuming the conversion of all convertible subsidiary equity into common.

**short_interest**: `int`<br/>
Number of shares that are reported short.

**short_percent_of_float**: `float`<br/>
Percentage of shares that are reported short, as a normalized percent.

**days_to_cover**: `float`<br/>
Number of days to repurchase the shares as a ratio of average daily volume

**short_interest_prev_month**: `int`<br/>
Number of shares that were reported short in the previous month.

**short_interest_prev_date**: `date`<br/>
Date of the previous month's report.

**insider_ownership**: `float`<br/>
Percentage of shares held by insiders, as a normalized percent.

**institution_ownership**: `float`<br/>
Percentage of shares held by institutions, as a normalized percent.

**institution_float_ownership**: `float`<br/>
Percentage of float held by institutions, as a normalized percent.

**institutions_count**: `int`<br/>
Number of institutions holding shares.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='eia' label='eia'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**symbol**: `str | list[str]`<br/>
Symbol to get data for. If provided, overrides the 'table' parameter to return only the specified symbol from the STEO API. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): eia.

**table**: `Literal['01', '02', '03a', '03b', '03c', '03d', '03e', '04a', '04b', '04c', '04d', '05a', '05b', '06', '07a', '07b', '07c', '07d1', '07d2', '07e', '08', '09a', '09b', '09c', '10a', '10b']`<br/>
*Default:* 01<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

The specific table within the STEO dataset. Default is '01'. When 'symbol' is provided, this parameter is ignored.<br/>
        01: US Energy Markets Summary<br/>
        02: Nominal Energy Prices<br/>
        03a: World Petroleum and Other Liquid Fuels Production, Consumption, and Inventories<br/>
        03b: Non-OPEC Petroleum and Other Liquid Fuels Production<br/>
        03c: World Petroleum and Other Liquid Fuels Production<br/>
        03d: World Crude Oil Production<br/>
        03e: World Petroleum and Other Liquid Fuels Consumption<br/>
        04a: US Petroleum and Other Liquid Fuels Supply, Consumption, and Inventories<br/>
        04b: US Hydrocarbon Gas Liquids (HGL) and Petroleum Refinery Balances<br/>
        04c: US Regional Motor Gasoline Prices and Inventories<br/>
        04d: US Biofuel Supply, Consumption, and Inventories<br/>
        05a: US Natural Gas Supply, Consumption, and Inventories<br/>
        05b: US Regional Natural Gas Prices<br/>
        06: US Coal Supply, Consumption, and Inventories<br/>
        07a: US Electricity Industry Overview<br/>
        07b: US Regional Electricity Retail Sales<br/>
        07c: US Regional Electricity Prices<br/>
        07d1: US Regional Electricity Generation, Electric Power Sector<br/>
        07d2: US Regional Electricity Generation, Electric Power Sector, continued<br/>
        07e: US Electricity Generating Capacity<br/>
        08: US Renewable Energy Consumption<br/>
        09a: US Macroeconomic Indicators and CO2 Emissions<br/>
        09b: US Regional Macroeconomic Data<br/>
        09c: US Regional Weather Data<br/>
        10a: Drilling Productivity Metrics<br/>
        10b: Crude Oil and Natural Gas Production from Shale and Tight Formations<br/>
</details>

**frequency**: `Literal['month', 'quarter', 'annual']`<br/>
*Default:* month<br/>
The frequency of the data. Default is 'month'.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

The date of the data.

)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**frequency**: `Literal['annual', 'quarter']`<br/>
Frequency aggregation to convert monthly data to lower frequency. None is monthly.

**aggregation_method**: `Literal['avg', 'sum', 'eop']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

A key that indicates the aggregation method used for frequency aggregation.<br/>
        <br/>
    avg = Average<br/>
        <br/>
    sum = Sum<br/>
        <br/>
    eop = End of Period<br/>
</details>

**transform**: `Literal['chg', 'ch1', 'pch', 'pc1', 'pca', 'cch', 'cca', 'log']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

Transformation type<br/>
        <br/>
    None = No transformation<br/>
        <br/>
    chg = Change<br/>
        <br/>
    ch1 = Change from Year Ago<br/>
        <br/>
    pch = Percent Change<br/>
        <br/>
    pc1 = Percent Change from Year Ago<br/>
        <br/>
    pca = Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
        <br/>
    cch = Continuously Compounded Rate of Change<br/>
        <br/>
    cca = Continuously Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
        <br/>
    log = Natural Log<br/>
</details>

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

title: "Tips Yields"

---

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

---

## Implementation details

### Class names

| Model name | Parameters class | Data class |
| ---------- | ---------------- | ---------- |
| `TipsYields` | `TipsYieldsQueryParams` | `TipsYieldsData` |

### Import Statement

```python
from openbb_core.provider.standard_models.tips_yields import (
TipsYieldsData,
TipsYieldsQueryParams,
)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**maturity**: `Literal['5', '10', '20', '30']`<br/>
The maturity of the security in years - 5, 10, 20, 30 - defaults to all. Note that the maturity is the tenor of the security, not the time to maturity.

**frequency**: `Literal['a', 'q', 'm', 'w', 'd', 'wef', 'weth', 'wew', 'wetu', 'wem', 'wesu', 'wesa', 'bwew', 'bwem']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

Frequency aggregation to convert high frequency data to lower frequency.<br/>
            None = No change<br/>
            a = Annual<br/>
            q = Quarterly<br/>
            m = Monthly<br/>
            w = Weekly<br/>
            d = Daily<br/>
            wef = Weekly, Ending Friday<br/>
            weth = Weekly, Ending Thursday<br/>
            wew = Weekly, Ending Wednesday<br/>
            wetu = Weekly, Ending Tuesday<br/>
            wem = Weekly, Ending Monday<br/>
            wesu = Weekly, Ending Sunday<br/>
            wesa = Weekly, Ending Saturday<br/>
            bwew = Biweekly, Ending Wednesday<br/>
            bwem = Biweekly, Ending Monday<br/>
</details>

**aggregation_method**: `Literal['avg', 'sum', 'eop']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

A key that indicates the aggregation method used for frequency aggregation.<br/>
            avg = Average<br/>
            sum = Sum<br/>
            eop = End of Period<br/>
</details>

**transform**: `Literal['chg', 'ch1', 'pch', 'pc1', 'pca', 'cch', 'cca']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

Transformation type<br/>
            None = No transformation<br/>
            chg = Change<br/>
            ch1 = Change from Year Ago<br/>
            pch = Percent Change<br/>
            pc1 = Percent Change from Year Ago<br/>
            pca = Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
            cch = Continuously Compounded Rate of Change<br/>
            cca = Continuously Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
</details>

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**symbol**: `str`<br/>
Symbol representing the entity requested in the data.

**due**: `date`<br/>
The due date (maturation date) of the security.

**name**: `str`<br/>
The name of the security.

**value**: `float`<br/>
The yield value.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**symbol**: `str`<br/>

---

## Implementation details

### Class names

| Model name | Parameters class | Data class |
| ---------- | ---------------- | ---------- |
| `TreasuryAuctions` | `TreasuryAuctionsQueryParams` | `TreasuryAuctionsData` |

### Import Statement

```python
from openbb_core.provider.standard_models. import (
TreasuryAuctionsData,
TreasuryAuctionsQueryParams,
)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**security_type**: `Literal['bill', 'note', 'bond', 'cmb', 'tips', 'frn']`<br/>
Used to only return securities of a particular type.

**cusip**: `str`<br/>
Filter securities by CUSIP.

**page_size**: `int`<br/>
Maximum number of results to return; you must also include pagenum when using pagesize.

**page_num**: `int`<br/>
The first page number to display results for; used in combination with page size.

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is 90 days ago.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is today.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='government_us' label='government_us'>

**security_type**: `Literal['bill', 'note', 'bond', 'cmb', 'tips', 'frn']`<br/>
Used to only return securities of a particular type.

**cusip**: `str`<br/>
Filter securities by CUSIP.

**page_size**: `int`<br/>
Maximum number of results to return; you must also include pagenum when using pagesize.

**page_num**: `int`<br/>
The first page number to display results for; used in combination with page size.

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is 90 days ago.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is today.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**cusip**: `str`<br/>
CUSIP of the Security.

**issue_date**: `date`<br/>
The issue date of the security.

**security_type**: `Literal['Bill', 'Note', 'Bond', 'CMB', 'TIPS', 'FRN']`<br/>
The type of security.

**security_term**: `str`<br/>
The term of the security.

**maturity_date**: `date`<br/>
The maturity date of the security.

**interest_rate**: `float`<br/>
The interest rate of the security.

**cpi_on_issue_date**: `float`<br/>
Reference CPI rate on the issue date of the security.

**cpi_on_dated_date**: `float`<br/>
Reference CPI rate on the dated date of the security.

**announcement_date**: `date`<br/>
The announcement date of the security.

**auction_date**: `date`<br/>
The auction date of the security.

**auction_date_year**: `int`<br/>
The auction date year of the security.

**dated_date**: `date`<br/>
The dated date of the security.

**first_payment_date**: `date`<br/>
The first payment date of the security.

**accrued_interest_per_100**: `float`<br/>
Accrued interest per $100.

**accrued_interest_per_1000**: `float`<br/>
Accrued interest per $1000.

**adjusted_accrued_interest_per_100**: `float`<br/>
Adjusted accrued interest per $100.

**adjusted_accrued_interest_per_1000**: `float`<br/>
Adjusted accrued interest per $1000.

**adjusted_price**: `float`<br/>
Adjusted price.

**allocation_percentage**: `float`<br/>
Allocation percentage, as normalized percentage points.

**allocation_percentage_decimals**: `float`<br/>
The number of decimals in the Allocation percentage.

**announced_cusip**: `str`<br/>
The announced CUSIP of the security.

**auction_format**: `str`<br/>
The auction format of the security.

**avg_median_discount_rate**: `float`<br/>
The average median discount rate of the security.

**avg_median_investment_rate**: `float`<br/>
The average median investment rate of the security.

**avg_median_price**: `float`<br/>
The average median price paid for the security.

**avg_median_discount_margin**: `float`<br/>
The average median discount margin of the security.

**avg_median_yield**: `float`<br/>
The average median yield of the security.

**back_dated**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether the security is back dated.

**back_dated_date**: `date`<br/>
The back dated date of the security.

**bid_to_cover_ratio**: `float`<br/>
The bid to cover ratio of the security.

**call_date**: `date`<br/>
The call date of the security.

**callable**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether the security is callable.

**called_date**: `date`<br/>
The called date of the security.

**cash_management_bill**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether the security is a cash management bill.

**closing_time_competitive**: `str`<br/>
The closing time for competitive bids on the security.

**closing_time_non_competitive**: `str`<br/>
The closing time for non-competitive bids on the security.

**competitive_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The accepted value for competitive bids on the security.

**competitive_accepted_decimals**: `int`<br/>
The number of decimals in the Competitive Accepted.

**competitive_tendered**: `int`<br/>
The tendered value for competitive bids on the security.

**competitive_tenders_accepted**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether competitive tenders are accepted on the security.

**corp_us_cusip**: `str`<br/>
The CUSIP of the security.

**cpi_base_reference_period**: `str`<br/>
The CPI base reference period of the security.

**currently_outstanding**: `int`<br/>
The currently outstanding value on the security.

**direct_bidder_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The accepted value from direct bidders on the security.

**direct_bidder_tendered**: `int`<br/>
The tendered value from direct bidders on the security.

**est_amount_of_publicly_held_maturing_security**: `int`<br/>
The estimated amount of publicly held maturing securities on the security.

**fima_included**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether the security is included in the FIMA (Foreign and International Money Authorities).

**fima_non_competitive_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The non-competitive accepted value on the security from FIMAs.

**fima_non_competitive_tendered**: `int`<br/>
The non-competitive tendered value on the security from FIMAs.

**first_interest_period**: `str`<br/>
The first interest period of the security.

**first_interest_payment_date**: `date`<br/>
The first interest payment date of the security.

**floating_rate**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether the security is a floating rate.

**frn_index_determination_date**: `date`<br/>
The FRN index determination date of the security.

**frn_index_determination_rate**: `float`<br/>
The FRN index determination rate of the security.

**high_discount_rate**: `float`<br/>
The high discount rate of the security.

**high_investment_rate**: `float`<br/>
The high investment rate of the security.

**high_price**: `float`<br/>
The high price of the security at auction.

**high_discount_margin**: `float`<br/>
The high discount margin of the security.

**high_yield**: `float`<br/>
The high yield of the security at auction.

**index_ratio_on_issue_date**: `float`<br/>
The index ratio on the issue date of the security.

**indirect_bidder_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The accepted value from indirect bidders on the security.

**indirect_bidder_tendered**: `int`<br/>
The tendered value from indirect bidders on the security.

**interest_payment_frequency**: `str`<br/>
The interest payment frequency of the security.

**low_discount_rate**: `float`<br/>
The low discount rate of the security.

**low_investment_rate**: `float`<br/>
The low investment rate of the security.

**low_price**: `float`<br/>
The low price of the security at auction.

**low_discount_margin**: `float`<br/>
The low discount margin of the security.

**low_yield**: `float`<br/>
The low yield of the security at auction.

**maturing_date**: `date`<br/>
The maturing date of the security.

**max_competitive_award**: `int`<br/>
The maximum competitive award at auction.

**max_non_competitive_award**: `int`<br/>
The maximum non-competitive award at auction.

**max_single_bid**: `int`<br/>
The maximum single bid at auction.

**min_bid_amount**: `int`<br/>
The minimum bid amount at auction.

**min_strip_amount**: `int`<br/>
The minimum strip amount at auction.

**min_to_issue**: `int`<br/>
The minimum to issue at auction.

**multiples_to_bid**: `int`<br/>
The multiples to bid at auction.

**multiples_to_issue**: `int`<br/>
The multiples to issue at auction.

**nlp_exclusion_amount**: `int`<br/>
The NLP exclusion amount at auction.

**nlp_reporting_threshold**: `int`<br/>
The NLP reporting threshold at auction.

**non_competitive_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The accepted value from non-competitive bidders on the security.

**non_competitive_tenders_accepted**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether or not the auction accepted non-competitive tenders.

**offering_amount**: `int`<br/>
The offering amount at auction.

**original_cusip**: `str`<br/>
The original CUSIP of the security.

**original_dated_date**: `date`<br/>
The original dated date of the security.

**original_issue_date**: `date`<br/>
The original issue date of the security.

**original_security_term**: `str`<br/>
The original term of the security.

**pdf_announcement**: `str`<br/>
The PDF filename for the announcement of the security.

**pdf_competitive_results**: `str`<br/>
The PDF filename for the competitive results of the security.

**pdf_non_competitive_results**: `str`<br/>
The PDF filename for the non-competitive results of the security.

**pdf_special_announcement**: `str`<br/>
The PDF filename for the special announcements.

**price_per_100**: `float`<br/>
The price per 100 of the security.

**primary_dealer_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The primary dealer accepted value on the security.

**primary_dealer_tendered**: `int`<br/>
The primary dealer tendered value on the security.

**reopening**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether or not the auction was reopened.

**security_term_day_month**: `str`<br/>
The security term in days or months.

**security_term_week_year**: `str`<br/>
The security term in weeks or years.

**series**: `str`<br/>
The series name of the security.

**soma_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The SOMA accepted value on the security.

**soma_holdings**: `int`<br/>
The SOMA holdings on the security.

**soma_included**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether or not the SOMA (System Open Market Account) was included on the security.

**soma_tendered**: `int`<br/>
The SOMA tendered value on the security.

**spread**: `float`<br/>
The spread on the security.

**standard_payment_per_1000**: `float`<br/>
The standard payment per 1000 of the security.

**strippable**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether or not the security is strippable.

**term**: `str`<br/>
The term of the security.

**tiin_conversion_factor_per_1000**: `float`<br/>
The TIIN conversion factor per 1000 of the security.

**tips**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether or not the security is TIPS.

**total_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The total accepted value at auction.

**total_tendered**: `int`<br/>
The total tendered value at auction.

**treasury_retail_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The accepted value on the security from retail.

**treasury_retail_tenders_accepted**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether or not the tender offers from retail are accepted

**type**: `str`<br/>
The type of issuance.  This might be different than the security type.

**unadjusted_accrued_interest_per_1000**: `float`<br/>
The unadjusted accrued interest per 1000 of the security.

**unadjusted_price**: `float`<br/>
The unadjusted price of the security.

**updated_timestamp**: `datetime`<br/>
The updated timestamp of the security.

**xml_announcement**: `str`<br/>
The XML filename for the announcement of the security.

**xml_competitive_results**: `str`<br/>
The XML filename for the competitive results of the security.

**xml_special_announcement**: `str`<br/>
The XML filename for special announcements.

**tint_cusip1**: `str`<br/>
Tint CUSIP 1.

**tint_cusip2**: `str`<br/>
Tint CUSIP 2.

title: "Treasury Constant Maturity"
description: "Treasury Constant Maturity"
---

## Implementation details

### Class names

| Model name | Parameters class | Data class |
| ---------- | ---------------- | ---------- |
| `TreasuryConstantMaturity` | `TreasuryConstantMaturityQueryParams` | `TreasuryConstantMaturityData` |

### Import Statement

```python
from openbb_core.provider.standard_models.tmc import (
TreasuryConstantMaturityData,
TreasuryConstantMaturityQueryParams,
)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**maturity**: `Literal['3m', '2y']`<br/>
*Default:* 3m<br/>
The maturity

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**maturity**: `Literal['3m', '2y']`<br/>
*Default:* 3m<br/>

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

---
title: "Treasury Prices"
description: "Government Treasury Prices by date"
---

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

---

## Implementation details

### Class names

| Model name | Parameters class | Data class |
| ---------- | ---------------- | ---------- |
| `TreasuryPrices` | `TreasuryPricesQueryParams` | `TreasuryPricesData` |

### Import Statement

```python
from openbb_core.provider.standard_models.treasury_prices import (
TreasuryPricesData,
TreasuryPricesQueryParams,
)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. Defaults to the last business day.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='government_us' label='government_us'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. Defaults to the last business day.

**cusip**: `str`<br/>
Filter by CUSIP.

**security_type**: `Literal['bill', 'note', 'bond', 'tips', 'frn']`<br/>
Filter by security type.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='tmx' label='tmx'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. Defaults to the last business day.

**govt_type**: `Literal['federal', 'provincial', 'municipal']`<br/>
*Default:* federal<br/>
The level of government issuer.

**issue_date_min**: `date`<br/>
Filter by the minimum original issue date.

**issue_date_max**: `date`<br/>
Filter by the maximum original issue date.

**last_traded_min**: `date`<br/>
Filter by the minimum last trade date.

**maturity_date_min**: `date`<br/>
Filter by the minimum maturity date.

**maturity_date_max**: `date`<br/>
Filter by the maximum maturity date.

**use_cache**: `bool`<br/>
*Default:* True<br/>
All bond data is sourced from a single JSON file that is updated daily. The file is cached for one day to eliminate downloading more than once. Caching will significantly speed up subsequent queries. To bypass, set to False.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**issuer_name**: `str`<br/>
Name of the issuing entity.

**cusip**: `str`<br/>
CUSIP of the security.

**isin**: `str`<br/>
ISIN of the security.

**security_type**: `str`<br/>
The type of Treasury security - i.e., Bill, Note, Bond, TIPS, FRN.

**issue_date**: `date`<br/>
The original issue date of the security.

**maturity_date**: `date`<br/>
The maturity date of the security.

**call_date**: `date`<br/>
The call date of the security.

**bid**: `float`<br/>
The bid price of the security.

**offer**: `float`<br/>
The offer price of the security.

**eod_price**: `float`<br/>
The end-of-day price of the security.

**last_traded_date**: `date`<br/>
The last trade date of the security.

**total_trades**: `int`<br/>
Total number of trades on the last traded date.

**last_price**: `float`<br/>
The last price of the security.

**highest_price**: `float`<br/>
The highest price for the bond on the last traded date.

**lowest_price**: `float`<br/>
The lowest price for the bond on the last traded date.

**rate**: `float`<br/>
The annualized interest rate or coupon of the security.

**ytm**: `float`<br/>
Yield to maturity (YTM) is the rate of return anticipated on a bond if it is held until the maturity date. It takes into account the current market price, par value, coupon rate and time to maturity. It is assumed that all coupons are reinvested at the same rate.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='government_us' label='government_us'>

**issuer_name**: `str`<br/>
Name of the issuing entity.

**cusip**: `str`<br/>
CUSIP of the security.

**isin**: `str`<br/>
ISIN of the security.

**security_type**: `str`<br/>
The type of Treasury security - i.e., Bill, Note, Bond, TIPS, FRN.

**issue_date**: `date`<br/>
The original issue date of the security.

**maturity_date**: `date`<br/>
The maturity date of the security.

**call_date**: `date`<br/>
The call date of the security.

**bid**: `float`<br/>
The bid price of the security.

**offer**: `float`<br/>
The offer price of the security.

**eod_price**: `float`<br/>
The end-of-day price of the security.

**last_traded_date**: `date`<br/>
The last trade date of the security.

**total_trades**: `int`<br/>
Total number of trades on the last traded date.

**last_price**: `float`<br/>
The last price of the security.

**highest_price**: `float`<br/>
The highest price for the bond on the last traded date.

**lowest_price**: `float`<br/>
The lowest price for the bond on the last traded date.

**rate**: `float`<br/>
The annualized interest rate or coupon of the security.

**ytm**: `float`<br/>
Yield to maturity (YTM) is the rate of return anticipated on a bond if it is held until the maturity date. It takes into account the current market price, par value, coupon rate and time to maturity. It is assumed that all coupons are reinvested at the same rate.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='tmx' label='tmx'>

**issuer_name**: `str`<br/>

**cusip**: `str`<br/>
CUSIP of the security.

The annualized interest rate or coupon of the security.

**ytm**: `float`<br/>
Yield to maturity (YTM) is the rate of return anticipated on a bond if it is held until the maturity date. It takes into account the current market price, par value, coupon rate and time to maturity. It is assumed that all coupons are reinvested at the same rate.

</TabItem>

title: "Unemployment"
description: "Get global unemployment data"
---

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

---

## Implementation details

### Class names

| Model name | Parameters class | Data class |
| ---------- | ---------------- | ---------- |
| `Unemployment` | `UnemploymentQueryParams` | `UnemploymentData` |

### Import Statement

```python
from openbb_core.provider.standard_models.unemployment import (
UnemploymentData,
UnemploymentQueryParams,
)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**country**: `str | list[str]`<br/>
*Default:* united_states<br/>
The country to get data. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): oecd.

**frequency**: `Literal['monthly', 'quarter', 'annual']`<br/>
*Default:* monthly<br/>
The frequency of the data.

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='oecd' label='oecd'>

**country**: `str`<br/>
*Default:* united_states<br/>
The country to get data.

**frequency**: `Literal['monthly', 'quarter', 'annual']`<br/>
*Default:* monthly<br/>
The frequency of the data.

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**sex**: `Literal['total', 'male', 'female']`<br/>
*Default:* total<br/>
Sex to get unemployment for.

**age**: `Literal['total', '15-24', '25+']`<br/>
*Default:* total<br/>
Age group to get unemployment for. Total indicates 15 years or over

**seasonal_adjustment**: `bool`<br/>
*Default:* False<br/>
Whether to get seasonally adjusted unemployment. Defaults to False.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**country**: `str`<br/>
Country for which unemployment rate is given

**value**: `float`<br/>
Unemployment rate, as a normalized percent.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='oecd' label='oecd'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**country**: `str`<br/>
Country for which unemployment rate is given

**value**: `float`<br/>
Unemployment rate, as a normalized percent.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

---
title: "University Of Michigan"
description: "Get University of Michigan Consumer Sentiment and Inflation Expectations Surveys"
---

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

---

## Implementation details

### Class names

| Model name | Parameters class | Data class |
| ---------- | ---------------- | ---------- |
| `UniversityOfMichigan` | `UniversityOfMichiganQueryParams` | `UniversityOfMichiganData` |

### Import Statement

```python
from openbb_core.provider.standard_models. import (
UniversityOfMichiganData,
UniversityOfMichiganQueryParams,
)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**frequency**: `Literal['quarter', 'annual']`<br/>
Frequency aggregation to convert monthly data to lower frequency. None is monthly.

**aggregation_method**: `Literal['avg', 'sum', 'eop']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

A key that indicates the aggregation method used for frequency aggregation.<br/>
        <br/>
    avg = Average<br/>
        <br/>
    sum = Sum<br/>
        <br/>
    eop = End of Period<br/>
</details>

**transform**: `Literal['chg', 'ch1', 'pch', 'pc1', 'pca', 'cch', 'cca', 'log']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

Transformation type<br/>
        <br/>
    None = No transformation<br/>
        <br/>
    chg = Change<br/>
        <br/>
    ch1 = Change from Year Ago<br/>
        <br/>
    pch = Percent Change<br/>
        <br/>
    pc1 = Percent Change from Year Ago<br/>
        <br/>
    pca = Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
        <br/>
    cch = Continuously Compounded Rate of Change<br/>
        <br/>
    cca = Continuously Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
        <br/>
    log = Natural Log<br/>
</details>

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**consumer_sentiment**: `float`<br/>
Index of the results of the University of Michigan's monthly Survey of Consumers, which is used to estimate future spending and saving.  (1966:Q1=100).

**inflation_expectation**: `float`<br/>
Median expected price change next 12 months, Surveys of Consumers.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**consumer_sentiment**: `float`<br/>
Index of the results of the University of Michigan's monthly Survey of Consumers, which is used to estimate future spending and saving.  (1966:Q1=100).

**inflation_expectation**: `float`<br/>
Median expected price change next 12 months, Surveys of Consumers.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

title: "World News"

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

---

## Implementation details

### Class names

| Model name | Parameters class | Data class |
| ---------- | ---------------- | ---------- |
| `WorldNews` | `WorldNewsQueryParams` | `WorldNewsData` |

### Import Statement

```python
from openbb_core.provider.standard_models.world_news import (
WorldNewsData,
WorldNewsQueryParams,
)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is 2 weeks ago.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is today.

**limit**: `Annotated[int, Ge(ge=0)]`<br/>
The number of data entries to return. The number of articles to return.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='benzinga' label='benzinga'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is 2 weeks ago.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is today.

**limit**: `Annotated[int, Ge(ge=0)]`<br/>
The number of data entries to return. The number of articles to return.

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
A specific date to get data for.

**display**: `Literal['headline', 'abstract', 'full']`<br/>
*Default:* full<br/>
Specify headline only (headline), headline + teaser (abstract), or headline + full body (full).

**updated_since**: `int`<br/>
Number of seconds since the news was updated.

**published_since**: `int`<br/>
Number of seconds since the news was published.

**sort**: `Literal['id', 'created', 'updated']`<br/>
*Default:* created<br/>
Key to sort the news by.

**order**: `Literal['asc', 'desc']`<br/>
*Default:* desc<br/>
Order to sort the news by.

**isin**: `str`<br/>
The ISIN of the news to retrieve.

**cusip**: `str`<br/>
The CUSIP of the news to retrieve.

**channels**: `str`<br/>
Channels of the news to retrieve.

**topics**: `str`<br/>
Topics of the news to retrieve.

**authors**: `str`<br/>
Authors of the news to retrieve.

**content_types**: `str`<br/>
Content types of the news to retrieve.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='biztoc' label='biztoc'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is 2 weeks ago.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is today.

**limit**: `Annotated[int, Ge(ge=0)]`<br/>
The number of data entries to return. The number of articles to return.

**term**: `str`<br/>
Search term to filter articles by. This overrides all other filters.

**source**: `str`<br/>
Filter by a specific publisher. Only valid when filter is set to source.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fmp' label='fmp'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is 2 weeks ago.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is today.

**limit**: `Annotated[int, Ge(ge=0)]`<br/>
The number of data entries to return. The number of articles to return.

**topic**: `Literal['fmp_articles', 'general', 'press_releases', 'stocks', 'forex', 'crypto']`<br/>
*Default:* general<br/>
The topic of the news to be fetched.

**page**: `int`<br/>
Page number of the results. Use in combination with limit.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='intrinio' label='intrinio'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is 2 weeks ago.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is today.

**limit**: `Annotated[int, Ge(ge=0)]`<br/>
The number of data entries to return. The number of articles to return.

**source**: `Literal['yahoo', 'moody', 'moody_us_news', 'moody_us_press_releases']`<br/>
The source of the news article.

**sentiment**: `Literal['positive', 'neutral', 'negative']`<br/>
Return news only from this source.

**language**: `str`<br/>
Filter by language. Unsupported for yahoo source.

**topic**: `str`<br/>
Filter by topic. Unsupported for yahoo source.

**word_count_greater_than**: `int`<br/>
News stories will have a word count greater than this value. Unsupported for yahoo source.

**word_count_less_than**: `int`<br/>
News stories will have a word count less than this value. Unsupported for yahoo source.

**is_spam**: `bool`<br/>
Filter whether it is marked as spam or not. Unsupported for yahoo source.

**business_relevance_greater_than**: `float`<br/>
News stories will have a business relevance score more than this value. Unsupported for yahoo source. Value is a decimal between 0 and 1.

**business_relevance_less_than**: `float`<br/>
News stories will have a business relevance score less than this value. Unsupported for yahoo source. Value is a decimal between 0 and 1.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='tiingo' label='tiingo'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is 2 weeks ago.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is today.

**limit**: `Annotated[int, Ge(ge=0)]`<br/>
The number of data entries to return. The number of articles to return.

**offset**: `int`<br/>
*Default:* 0<br/>
Page offset, used in conjunction with limit.

**source**: `str | list[str]`<br/>
A comma-separated list of the domains requested. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): tiingo.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

**title**: `str`<br/>

**author**: `str`<br/>

**excerpt**: `str`<br/>

**images**: `Any`<br/>
Images associated with the article.

**source**: `str`<br/>

**topics**: `str`<br/>

**business_relevance**: `float`<br/>

**spam**: `bool`<br/>
Whether the news article is spam.

**copyright**: `str`<br/>
The copyright notice of the news article.

**id**: `str`<br/>
Article ID.

**company**: `IntrinioCompany`<br/>
The Intrinio Company object. Contains details company reference data.

**security**: `IntrinioSecurity`<br/>
The Intrinio Security object. Contains the security details related to the news article.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='tiingo' label='tiingo'>

**date**: `Union[datetime, str]`<br/>
The date of the data. The date of publication.

**title**: `str`<br/>
Title of the article.

**author**: `str`<br/>
Author of the article.

**excerpt**: `str`<br/>
Excerpt of the article text.

**body**: `str`<br/>
Body of the article text.

**images**: `Any`<br/>
Images associated with the article.

**url**: `str`<br/>
URL to the article.

**symbols**: `str`<br/>
Ticker tagged in the fetched news.

**article_id**: `int`<br/>
Unique ID of the news article.

**site**: `str`<br/>
News source.

**tags**: `str`<br/>
Tags associated with the news article.

**crawl_date**: `datetime`<br/>
Date the news article was crawled.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>



---

---
title: "Yield Curve"
description: "Get yield curve data by country and date"
---

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

---

## Implementation details

### Class names

| Model name | Parameters class | Data class |
| ---------- | ---------------- | ---------- |
| `YieldCurve` | `YieldCurveQueryParams` | `YieldCurveData` |

### Import Statement

```python
from openbb_core.provider.standard_models.yield_curve import (
YieldCurveData,
YieldCurveQueryParams,
)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**date**: `Union[date | str, list[date | str]]`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. By default is the current data. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): ecb, econdb, federal_reserve, fmp, fred.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='ecb' label='ecb'>

**date**: `Union[date | str, list[date | str]]`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. By default is the current data. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): ecb, econdb, federal_reserve, fmp, fred.

**rating**: `Literal['aaa', 'all_ratings']`<br/>
*Default:* aaa<br/>
The rating type, either 'aaa' or 'all_ratings'.

**yield_curve_type**: `Literal['spot_rate', 'instantaneous_forward', 'par_yield']`<br/>
*Default:* spot_rate<br/>
The yield curve type.

**use_cache**: `bool`<br/>
*Default:* True<br/>
If true, cache the request for four hours.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='econdb' label='econdb'>

**date**: `Union[date | str, list[date | str]]`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. By default is the current data. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): ecb, econdb, federal_reserve, fmp, fred.

**country**: `str | list[str]`<br/>
*Default:* united_states<br/>
The country to get data. New Zealand, Mexico, Singapore, and Thailand have only monthly data. The nearest date to the requested one will be used. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): econdb.

<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Choices</summary>

- australia
- canada
- china
- ecb_instantaneous_forward
- ecb_par_yield
- ecb_spot_rate
- hong_kong
- india
- japan
- mexico
- new_zealand
- russia
- saudi_arabia
- singapore
- south_africa
- south_korea
- taiwan
- thailand
- united_kingdom
- united_states
</details>

**use_cache**: `bool`<br/>
*Default:* True<br/>
If true, cache the request for four hours.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='federal_reserve' label='federal_reserve'>

**date**: `Union[date | str, list[date | str]]`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. By default is the current data. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): ecb, econdb, federal_reserve, fmp, fred.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fmp' label='fmp'>

**date**: `Union[date | str, list[date | str]]`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. By default is the current data. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): ecb, econdb, federal_reserve, fmp, fred.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**date**: `Union[date | str, list[date | str]]`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. By default is the current data. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): ecb, econdb, federal_reserve, fmp, fred.

**yield_curve_type**: `Literal['nominal', 'real', 'breakeven', 'treasury_minus_fed_funds', 'corporate_spot', 'corporate_par']`<br/>
*Default:* nominal<br/>
Yield curve type. Nominal and Real Rates are available daily, others are monthly. The closest date to the requested date will be returned.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**maturity**: `str`<br/>
Maturity length of the security.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='ecb' label='ecb'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**maturity**: `str`<br/>
Maturity length of the security.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='econdb' label='econdb'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**maturity**: `str`<br/>
Maturity length of the security.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='federal_reserve' label='federal_reserve'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**maturity**: `str`<br/>
Maturity length of the security.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fmp' label='fmp'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**maturity**: `str`<br/>
Maturity length of the security.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**maturity**: `str`<br/>
Maturity length of the security.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>
