---
title: "country_portfolio_returns"
description: "Country portfolio returns"
keywords:
- famafrench
- country_portfolio_returns
---

import HeadTitle from '@site/src/components/General/HeadTitle.tsx';

<HeadTitle title="famafrench/country_portfolio_returns - Reference | OpenBB Docs" />

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

Country portfolio returns.

Metadata for the selected dataset are returned in the
`extra['results_metadata']` field of the response.

Source
------

https://mba.tuck.dartmouth.edu/pages/faculty/ken.french/data_library.html

We form value and growth portfolios in each country using four valuation ratios:

- book-to-market (B/M)
- earnings-price (E/P)
- cash earnings to price (CE/P)
- dividend yield (D/P)

We form the portfolios at the end of December each year by sorting on one of the four ratios and
then compute value-weighted returns for the following 12 months.

The value portfolios (High) contain firms in the top 30% of a ratio
and the growth portfolios (Low) contain firms in the bottom 30%.

There are two sets of portfolios.

In one, firms are included only if we have data on all four ratios.

In the other, a firm is included in a sort variable's portfolios
if we have data for that variable.

The market return (Mkt) for the first set is the value weighted average of the returns
for only firms with all four ratios.

The market return for the second set includes all firms with book-to-market data,
and Firms is the number of firms with B/M data.


Examples
--------

```python
from openbb import obb
# Get model Country portfolio returns used for constructing the Fama-French Factor models.
obb.famafrench.country_portfolio_returns(provider='famafrench')
# Parameters are different than the regional and US portfolio returns.
obb.famafrench.country_portfolio_returns(provider='famafrench', frequency=annual, measure=local, country=japan, dividends=False, all_data_items_required=False)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='famafrench' label='famafrench'>

**country**: `Literal['austria', 'australia', 'belgium', 'canada', 'denmark', 'finland', 'france', 'germany', 'hong_kong', 'ireland', 'italy', 'japan', 'malaysia', 'netherlands', 'new_zealand', 'norway', 'singapore', 'spain', 'sweden', 'switzerland', 'united_kingdom']`<br/>
*Default:* united_kingdom<br/>
Country to fetch the portfolio returns for.

**measure**: `Literal['usd', 'local', 'ratios']`<br/>
*Default:* usd<br/>
The measure to fetch for the portfolio. Only 'annual' frequency is supported for 'ratios'.

**frequency**: `Literal['monthly', 'annual']`<br/>
*Default:* monthly<br/>
The frequency of the data to fetch. Ignored when `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**dividends**: `bool`<br/>
When False, portoflios exclude dividends.

**all_data_items_required**: `bool`<br/>
If True (default), includes firms with data for all four ratios. When False, includes only firms with Book-to-Market (B/M) data.

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
The start date for the data. Defaults to the earliest available date.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
The end date for the data. Defaults to the latest available date.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

---

## Returns

**results**: `list[FamaFrenchCountryPortfolioReturns]`

Serializable results.

**provider**: `Optional[Literal['famafrench']]`

Provider name.

**warnings**: `Optional[list[Warning_]]`

list of warnings.

**chart**: `Optional[Chart]`

Chart object.

**extra**: `dict[str, Any]`

Extra info.

---
## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='famafrench' label='famafrench'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**mkt**: `float`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

The market return (Mkt) for the first set is the value weighted average<br/>
        of the returns for only firms with all four ratios.<br/>
<br/>
        The market return for the second set includes all firms with book-to-market data,<br/>
        and Firms is the number of firms with B/M data.<br/>
<br/>
        Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.<br/>
</details>

**firms**: `int`<br/>
The number of firms, relative to `all_data_items_required` parameter. Only returned when `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**bm**: `float`<br/>
Book to Market equity ratio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**be_me_high**: `float`<br/>
Book Equity to Market Equity returns for the value portfolio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**be_me_low**: `float`<br/>
Book Equity to Market Equity returns for the growth portfolio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**ep**: `float`<br/>
Earnings to Price ratio. Only returned when `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**e_p_high**: `float`<br/>
Earnings to Price returns for the value portfolio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**e_p_low**: `float`<br/>
Earnings to Price returns for the growth portfolio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**ce_p**: `float`<br/>
Cash Earnings to Price ratio. Only returned when `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**ce_p_high**: `float`<br/>
Cash Earnings to Price returns for the value portfolio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**ce_p_low**: `float`<br/>
Cash Earnings to Price returns for the growth portfolio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**yld**: `float`<br/>
Dividend Yield ratio. Only returned when `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**yld_high**: `float`<br/>
Dividend Yield returns for the value portfolio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**yld_low**: `float`<br/>
Dividend Yield returns for the growth portfolio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**yld_zero**: `float`<br/>
Dividend Yield returns for firms not paying dividends. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

---
title: "factors"
description: "Fama-French factors"
keywords:
- famafrench
- factors
---

import HeadTitle from '@site/src/components/General/HeadTitle.tsx';

<HeadTitle title="famafrench/factors - Reference | OpenBB Docs" />

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

Fama-French factors.

Metadata for the selected dataset are returned in the
`extra['results_metadata']` field of the response.

Source
------

https://mba.tuck.dartmouth.edu/pages/faculty/ken.french/data_library.html

All returns are in U.S. dollars, include dividends and capital gains,
and are not continuously compounded.

Market is the return on a region's value-weight market portfolio
minus the U.S. one month T-bill rate.

The Fama/French 5 factors (2x3) are constructed using the 6,
value-weight, portfolios formed on size and book-to-market, the 6,
value-weight, portfolios formed on size and operating profitability,
and the 6, value-weight, portfolios formed on size and investment.

To construct the SMB, HML, RMW, and CMA factors, we sort stocks in a
region into two market cap and three respective book-to-market equity (B/M),
operating profitability (OP), and investment (INV) groups at the end of each June.

Big stocks are those in the top 90% of June market cap for the region,
and small stocks are those in the bottom 10%.
The B/M, OP, and INV breakpoints for a region are the 30th and 70th percentiles
of respective ratios for the big stocks of the region.

Rm–Rf for July of year t to June of t+1 include all stocks
for which we have market equity data for June of t.
SMB, HML, RMW, and CMA for July of year t to June of t+1 include all stocks
for which we have market equity data for December of t-1
and June of t, (positive) book equity data for t-1 (for SMB, HML, and RMW),
non-missing revenues and at least one of the following: cost of goods sold,
selling, general and administrative expenses, or interest expense for
t-1 (for SMB and RMW), and total assets data for t-2 and t-1 (for SMB and CMA).

The momentum and short term reversal portfolios are reconstituted monthly
and the other research portfolios are reconstituted annually.
We reconstruct the full history of returns each month when we update the portfolios.


Examples
--------

```python
from openbb import obb
# Fama-French 3-factors data for America, default is monthly.
obb.famafrench.factors(provider='famafrench')
# Fama-French 5-factors data for Europe.
obb.famafrench.factors(provider='famafrench', region=europe, factor=5_factors)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='famafrench' label='famafrench'>

**region**: `Literal['america', 'north_america', 'europe', 'japan', 'asia_pacific_ex_japan', 'developed', 'developed_ex_us', 'emerging']`<br/>
*Default:* america<br/>
Region of focus. Default is America.

**factor**: `Literal['5_factors', '3_factors', 'momentum', 'st_reversal', 'lt_reversal']`<br/>
*Default:* 3_factors<br/>
Factor to fetch. Default is the 3-Factor Model.Short/long-term reversals are available only for America.

**frequency**: `Literal['daily', 'weekly', 'monthly', 'annual']`<br/>
*Default:* monthly<br/>
Frequency of the factor data.Not all are available for all regions, and intervals depend on the factor selected. Weekly is only available for the US 3-Factor Model.

**start_date**: `date`<br/>
Start date of the data. Defaults to the complete data range.

**end_date**: `date`<br/>
End date of the data. Defaults to the complete data range.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

---

## Returns

**results**: `list[FamaFrenchFactors]`

Serializable results.

**provider**: `Optional[Literal['famafrench']]`

Provider name.

**warnings**: `Optional[list[Warning_]]`

list of warnings.

**chart**: `Optional[Chart]`

Chart object.

**extra**: `dict[str, Any]`

Extra info.

---
## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='famafrench' label='famafrench'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
Date of the factor data.

**mkt_rf**: `float`<br/>
Excess return on the market, value-weighted return of all firms, minus the one-month Treasury bill rate. Not returned for momentum or reversal factors.

**smb**: `float`<br/>
Small minus big (SMB) factor returns. Average return of small minus big stock portfolios. Not returned for momentum or reversal factors.

**hml**: `float`<br/>
High minus low (HML) factor returns. Average return on value minus average return on growth portfolios. Not returned for momentum or reversal factors.

**rmw**: `float`<br/>
Robust minus weak (RMW) factor returns. Average return on robust operating profitability portfolios, minus average return on weak operating profitability portfolios. Only returned when 5 Factor model is selected.

**cma**: `float`<br/>
Conservative minus aggressive (CMA) factor returns. Average return on conservative investment portfolios, minus average return on aggressive investment portfolios. Only returned when 5 Factor model is selected.

**rf**: `float`<br/>
Risk-free rate (RF) returns. The one-month US Treasury bill rate. Not returned when momentum or reversal factors are selected.

**mom**: `float`<br/>
Momentum (Mom) factor returns. Returned only when the momentum factor is selected and the region is 'america'.

**wml**: `float`<br/>
Winners minus losers (WML) factor returns. Equal-weight average of the returns for the winner portfolios minus the average of the returns for the loser portfolios. Returned only when the momentum factor is selected, and the region is not 'america'.

**lt_rev**: `float`<br/>
Long-term reversal (LT_Rev) factor returns. Returned only when the long-term reversal factor is selected, and the region is 'america'.

**st_rev**: `float`<br/>
Short-term reversal (ST_Rev) factor returns. Returned only when the short-term reversal factor is selected, and the region is 'america'.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>



---

---
title: "international_index_returns"
description: "International index returns"
keywords:
- famafrench
- international_index_returns
---

import HeadTitle from '@site/src/components/General/HeadTitle.tsx';

<HeadTitle title="famafrench/international_index_returns - Reference | OpenBB Docs" />

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

International index returns.

Metadata for the selected dataset are returned in the
`extra['results_metadata']` field of the response.

See the `country_portfolio_returns` endpoint for more details.

Source
------

https://mba.tuck.dartmouth.edu/pages/faculty/ken.french/data_library.html

The returns on the index portfolios are constructed by
averaging the returns on the country portfolios.

We weight countries in the index portfolios in proportion to their EAFE + Canada weights.

Each country is added to the index portfolios when the return data for the country begin;
the country start dates can be inferred from the country return files.


Examples
--------

```python
from openbb import obb
# Get benchmark index returns used for constructing the international Fama-French Factor models.
obb.famafrench.international_index_returns(provider='famafrench')
# Parameters are similar to the country portfolio returns.
obb.famafrench.international_index_returns(provider='famafrench', frequency=annual, measure=ratios, index=europe_ex_uk, dividends=False, all_data_items_required=False)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='famafrench' label='famafrench'>

**index**: `Literal['uk', 'scandinavia', 'europe', 'europe_ex_uk', 'asia_pacific', 'all']`<br/>
*Default:* all<br/>
International index to fetch the portfolio returns for. Defaults to 'all'.

**measure**: `Literal['usd', 'local', 'ratios']`<br/>
*Default:* usd<br/>
The measure to fetch for the portfolio. Only 'annual' frequency is supported for 'ratios'.

**frequency**: `Literal['monthly', 'annual']`<br/>
*Default:* monthly<br/>
The frequency of the data to fetch. Ignored when `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**dividends**: `bool`<br/>
When False, portoflios exclude dividends.

**all_data_items_required**: `bool`<br/>
If True (default), includes firms with data for all four ratios. When False, includes only firms with Book-to-Market (B/M) data.

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
The start date for the data. Defaults to the earliest available date.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
The end date for the data. Defaults to the latest available date.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

---

## Returns

**results**: `list[FamaFrenchInternationalIndexReturns]`

Serializable results.

**provider**: `Optional[Literal['famafrench']]`

Provider name.

**warnings**: `Optional[list[Warning_]]`

list of warnings.

**chart**: `Optional[Chart]`

Chart object.

**extra**: `dict[str, Any]`

Extra info.

---
## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='famafrench' label='famafrench'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**mkt**: `float`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

The market return (Mkt) for the first set is the value weighted average<br/>
        of the returns for only firms with all four ratios.<br/>
<br/>
        The market return for the second set includes all firms with book-to-market data,<br/>
        and Firms is the number of firms with B/M data.<br/>
<br/>
        Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.<br/>
</details>

**firms**: `int`<br/>
The number of firms, relative to `all_data_items_required` parameter. Only returned when `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**bm**: `float`<br/>
Book to Market equity ratio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**be_me_high**: `float`<br/>
Book Equity to Market Equity returns for the value portfolio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**be_me_low**: `float`<br/>
Book Equity to Market Equity returns for the growth portfolio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**ep**: `float`<br/>
Earnings to Price ratio. Only returned when `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**e_p_high**: `float`<br/>
Earnings to Price returns for the value portfolio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**e_p_low**: `float`<br/>
Earnings to Price returns for the growth portfolio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**ce_p**: `float`<br/>
Cash Earnings to Price ratio. Only returned when `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**ce_p_high**: `float`<br/>
Cash Earnings to Price returns for the value portfolio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**ce_p_low**: `float`<br/>
Cash Earnings to Price returns for the growth portfolio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**yld**: `float`<br/>
Dividend Yield ratio. Only returned when `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**yld_high**: `float`<br/>
Dividend Yield returns for the value portfolio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**yld_low**: `float`<br/>
Dividend Yield returns for the growth portfolio. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

**yld_zero**: `float`<br/>
Dividend Yield returns for firms not paying dividends. Not returned if `measure` is set to 'ratios'.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

---
title: "regional_portfolio_returns"
description: "Regional portfolio returns"
keywords:
- famafrench
- regional_portfolio_returns
---

import HeadTitle from '@site/src/components/General/HeadTitle.tsx';

<HeadTitle title="famafrench/regional_portfolio_returns - Reference | OpenBB Docs" />

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

Regional portfolio returns.

Metadata for the selected dataset are returned in the
`extra['results_metadata']` field of the response.

See the `us_portfolio_returns` endpoint for more details.


Examples
--------

```python
from openbb import obb
# Get model Regional portfolio returns used for constructing the Fama-French Factor models.
obb.famafrench.regional_portfolio_returns(provider='famafrench')
# Get portfolios formed by equal-weight, with annual returns.
obb.famafrench.regional_portfolio_returns(provider='famafrench', frequency=annual, measure=equal)
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='famafrench' label='famafrench'>

'north_america_6_portfolios_me_prior_250_20_daily']`<br/>
*Default:* developed_ex_us_6_portfolios_me_op<br/>
The specific portfolio file to fetch.

**measure**: `Literal['value', 'equal', 'number_of_firms', 'firm_size']`<br/>
*Default:* value<br/>
The measure to fetch for the portfolio.

**frequency**: `Literal['monthly', 'annual']`<br/>
*Default:* monthly<br/>
The frequency of the data to fetch. Ignored when the portfolio ends with 'daily'.

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
The start date for the data. Defaults to the earliest available date.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
The end date for the data. Defaults to the latest available date.

---
title: "us_portfolio_returns"
description: "US Portfolio returns"
keywords:
- famafrench
- us_portfolio_returns
---

import HeadTitle from '@site/src/components/General/HeadTitle.tsx';

<HeadTitle title="famafrench/us_portfolio_returns - Reference | OpenBB Docs" />

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

US Portfolio returns.

Metadata for the selected dataset are returned in the
`extra['results_metadata']` field of the response.

Source
------

https://mba.tuck.dartmouth.edu/pages/faculty/ken.french/data_library.html

All returns are in U.S. dollars, include dividends (unless the portfolio is 'wout_div')
and capital gains, and are not continuously compounded.


The momentum and short term reversal portfolios are reconstituted monthly
and the other research portfolios are reconstituted annually.
We reconstruct the full history of returns each month when we update the portfolios.


Size and Book-to-Market Portfolios
----------------------------------

- Small Value
- Small Neutral
- Small Growth
- Big Value
- Big Neutral
- Big Growth

BE < 0; bottom 30%, middle 40%, top 30%; quintiles; deciles.
Firms with negative book equity are in only the BE < 0 portfolio.

Size and Operating Profitability Portfolios
-------------------------------------------

- Small Robust
- Small Neutral
- Small Weak
- Big Robust
- Big Neutral
- Big Weak

Operating Profitability bottom 30%, middle 40%, top 30%; quintiles; deciles.

Size and Investment Portfolios
------------------------------

- Small Conservative
- Small Neutral
- Small Aggressive
- Big Conservative
- Big Neutral
- Big Aggressive

ME < 0 (not used); bottom 30%, middle 40%, top 30%; quintiles; deciles.
Investment bottom 30%, middle 40%, top 30%; quintiles; deciles.

Definitions
-----------

ME : Market Equity

Market equity (size) is price times shares outstanding.
Price and shares outstanding are from CRSP.

BE : Book Equity

Book equity is constructed from Compustat data or collected from the
Moody’s Industrial, Financial, and Utilities manuals.
BE is the book value of stockholders’ equity, plus balance sheet deferred taxes
and investment tax credit (if available), minus the book value of preferred stock.
Depending on availability, we use the redemption, liquidation, or par value (in that order)
to estimate the book value of preferred stock. Stockholders’ equity is the value reported
by Moody’s or Compustat, if it is available. If not, we measure stockholders’ equity as
the book value of common equity plus the par value of preferred stock,
or the book value of assets minus total liabilities (in that order).

See Davis, Fama, and French, 2000,
“Characteristics, Covariances, and Average Returns: 1929-1997”
Journal of Finance, for more details.

BE/ME : Book-to-Market

The book-to-market ratio used to form portfolios in June of year t is book equity
for the fiscal year ending in calendar year t-1,
divided by market equity at the end of December of t-1.

OP : Operating Profitability

The operating profitability ratio used to form portfolios in June of year t is annual revenues
minus cost of goods sold, interest expense, and selling, general, and administrative expense
divided by the sum of book equity and minority interest for the last fiscal year ending in t-1.

INV : Investment

The investment ratio used to form portfolios in June of year t is the change in total assets
from the fiscal year ending in year t-2 to the fiscal year ending in t-1,
divided by t-2 total assets.

E/P : Earnings/Price

Earnings is total earnings before extraordinary items, from Compustat.
The earnings/price ratio used to form portfolios in June of year t is earnings
for the fiscal year ending in calendar year t-1,
divided by market equity at the end of December of t-1.

CF/P : Cashflow/Price

Cashflow is total earnings before extraordinary items, plus equity’s share of depreciation,
plus deferred taxes (if available), from Compustat. Equity’s share is defined as market equity
divided by assets minus book equity plus market equity.
The cashflow/price ratio used to form portfolios in June of year t is the cashflow for the
fiscal year ending in calendar year t-1, divided by market equity at the end of December of t-1.

D/P : Dividend Yield

The dividend yield used to form portfolios in June of year t is the total dividends paid
from July of t-1 to June of t per dollar of equity in June of t.
The dividend yield is computed using the with and without dividend returns from CRSP,
as described in Fama and French, 1988, “Dividend yields and expected stock returns,”
Journal of Financial Economics 25.


Examples
--------

```python
from openbb import obb
# Get model US portfolio returns used for constructing the Fama-French Factor models.
obb.famafrench.us_portfolio_returns(provider='famafrench')
# If the portfolio name does not have a frequency - i.e. '_daily' - use the frequency parameter to specify the interval.
obb.famafrench.us_portfolio_returns(provider='famafrench', portfolio=5_industry_portfolios_wout_div, frequency=annual, measure=equal)
```

*Default:* portfolios_formed_on_me<br/>

---
title: "bond_indices"
description: "Bond Indices"
keywords:
- fixedincome
- bond_indices
---

import HeadTitle from '@site/src/components/General/HeadTitle.tsx';

<HeadTitle title="fixedincome/bond_indices - Reference | OpenBB Docs" />

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

Bond Indices.


Examples
--------

```python
from openbb import obb
# The default state for FRED are series for constructing the US Corporate Bond Yield Curve.
obb.fixedincome.bond_indices(provider='fred')
# Multiple indices, from within the same 'category', can be requested.
obb.fixedincome.bond_indices(category=high_yield, index=us,europe,emerging, index_type='total_return', provider='fred')
# From FRED, there are three main categories, 'high_yield', 'us', and 'emerging_markets'. Emerging markets is a broad category.
obb.fixedincome.bond_indices(category=emerging_markets, index=corporate,private_sector,public_sector, provider='fred')
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**index_type**: `Literal['yield', 'yield_to_worst', 'total_return', 'oas']`<br/>
*Default:* yield<br/>
The type of series. OAS is the option-adjusted spread. Default is yield.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**index_type**: `Literal['yield', 'yield_to_worst', 'total_return', 'oas']`<br/>
*Default:* yield<br/>
The type of series. OAS is the option-adjusted spread. Default is yield.

**category**: `Literal['high_yield', 'us', 'emerging_markets']`<br/>
*Default:* us<br/>
The type of index category. Used in conjunction with 'index', default is 'us'.

**index**: `str | list[str]`<br/>
*Default:* yield_curve<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

The specific index to query. Used in conjunction with 'category' and 'index_type', default is 'yield_curve'.<br/>
        Possible values are:<br/>
            corporate<br/>
            seasoned_corporate<br/>
            liquid_corporate<br/>
            yield_curve<br/>
            crossover<br/>
            public_sector<br/>
            private_sector<br/>
            non_financial<br/>
            high_grade<br/>
            high_yield<br/>
            liquid_emea<br/>
            emea<br/>
            liquid_asia<br/>
            asia<br/>
            liquid_latam<br/>
            latam<br/>
            liquid_aaa<br/>
            liquid_bbb<br/>
            aaa<br/>
            aa<br/>
            a<br/>
            bbb<br/>
            bb<br/>
            b<br/>
            ccc Multiple items allowed for provider(s): fred.<br/>
</details>

<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Choices</summary>

- a
- aa
- aaa
- asia
- b
- bb
- bbb
- ccc
- corporate
- crossover
- emea
- high_grade
- high_yield
- latam
- liquid_aaa
- liquid_asia
- liquid_bbb
- liquid_corporate
- liquid_emea
- liquid_latam
- non_financial
- private_sector
- public_sector
- seasoned_corporate
- yield_curve
</details>

**frequency**: `Literal['a', 'q', 'm', 'w', 'd', 'wef', 'weth', 'wew', 'wetu', 'wem', 'wesu', 'wesa', 'bwew', 'bwem']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

Frequency aggregation to convert daily data to lower frequency.<br/>
            None = No change<br/>
            a = Annual<br/>
            q = Quarterly<br/>
            m = Monthly<br/>
            w = Weekly<br/>
            d = Daily<br/>
            wef = Weekly, Ending Friday<br/>
            weth = Weekly, Ending Thursday<br/>
            wew = Weekly, Ending Wednesday<br/>
            wetu = Weekly, Ending Tuesday<br/>
            wem = Weekly, Ending Monday<br/>
            wesu = Weekly, Ending Sunday<br/>
            wesa = Weekly, Ending Saturday<br/>
            bwew = Biweekly, Ending Wednesday<br/>
            bwem = Biweekly, Ending Monday<br/>
</details>

**aggregation_method**: `Literal['avg', 'sum', 'eop']`<br/>
*Default:* avg<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

A key that indicates the aggregation method used for frequency aggregation.<br/>
        This parameter has no affect if the frequency parameter is not set, default is 'avg'.<br/>
            avg = Average<br/>
            sum = Sum<br/>
            eop = End of Period<br/>
</details>

**transform**: `Literal['chg', 'ch1', 'pch', 'pc1', 'pca', 'cch', 'cca', 'log']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

Transformation type<br/>
            None = No transformation<br/>
            chg = Change<br/>
            ch1 = Change from Year Ago<br/>
            pch = Percent Change<br/>
            pc1 = Percent Change from Year Ago<br/>
            pca = Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
            cch = Continuously Compounded Rate of Change<br/>
            cca = Continuously Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
            log = Natural Log<br/>
</details>

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

---

## Returns

**results**: `list[BondIndices]`

Serializable results.

**provider**: `Optional[Literal['fred']]`

Provider name.

**warnings**: `Optional[list[Warning_]]`

list of warnings.

**chart**: `Optional[Chart]`

Chart object.

**extra**: `dict[str, Any]`

Extra info.

---
## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**symbol**: `str`<br/>
Symbol representing the entity requested in the data.

**value**: `float`<br/>
Index values.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**symbol**: `str`<br/>
Symbol representing the entity requested in the data.

**value**: `float`<br/>
Index values.

**maturity**: `str`<br/>
The maturity range of the bond index. Only applicable when 'index' is 'yield_curve'.

**title**: `str`<br/>
The title of the index.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

import HeadTitle from '@site/src/components/General/HeadTitle.tsx';

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

Corporate Bond Prices.


Examples
--------

```python
from openbb import obb
obb.fixedincome.corporate.bond_prices(provider='tmx')
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**country**: `str`<br/>
The country to get data. Matches partial name.

**issuer_name**: `str`<br/>
Name of the issuer.  Returns partial matches and is case insensitive.

**isin**: `Union[Union[list, str], list[Union[list, str]]]`<br/>
International Securities Identification Number(s) of the bond(s). Multiple items allowed for provider(s): tmx.

**lei**: `str`<br/>
Legal Entity Identifier of the issuing entity.

**currency**: `Union[list, str]`<br/>
Currency of the bond. Formatted as the 3-letter ISO 4217 code (e.g. GBP, EUR, USD).

**coupon_min**: `float`<br/>
Minimum coupon rate of the bond.

**coupon_max**: `float`<br/>
Maximum coupon rate of the bond.

**issued_amount_min**: `int`<br/>
Minimum issued amount of the bond.

**issued_amount_max**: `str`<br/>
Maximum issued amount of the bond.

**maturity_date_min**: `date`<br/>
Minimum maturity date of the bond.

**maturity_date_max**: `date`<br/>
Maximum maturity date of the bond.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='tmx' label='tmx'>

**country**: `str`<br/>
The country to get data. Matches partial name.

**issuer_name**: `str`<br/>
Name of the issuer.  Returns partial matches and is case insensitive.

**isin**: `Union[Union[list, str], list[Union[list, str]]]`<br/>
International Securities Identification Number(s) of the bond(s). Multiple items allowed for provider(s): tmx.

**lei**: `str`<br/>
Legal Entity Identifier of the issuing entity.

**currency**: `Union[list, str]`<br/>
Currency of the bond. Formatted as the 3-letter ISO 4217 code (e.g. GBP, EUR, USD).

**coupon_min**: `float`<br/>
Minimum coupon rate of the bond.

**coupon_max**: `float`<br/>
Maximum coupon rate of the bond.

**issued_amount_min**: `int`<br/>
Minimum issued amount of the bond.

**issued_amount_max**: `str`<br/>
Maximum issued amount of the bond.

**maturity_date_min**: `date`<br/>
Minimum maturity date of the bond.

**maturity_date_max**: `date`<br/>
Maximum maturity date of the bond.

**issue_date_min**: `date`<br/>
Filter by the minimum original issue date.

**issue_date_max**: `date`<br/>
Filter by the maximum original issue date.

**last_traded_min**: `date`<br/>
Filter by the minimum last trade date.

**use_cache**: `bool`<br/>
*Default:* True<br/>
All bond data is sourced from a single JSON file that is updated daily. The file is cached for one day to eliminate downloading more than once. Caching will significantly speed up subsequent queries. To bypass, set to False.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

---

## Returns

**results**: `list[BondPrices]`

Serializable results.

**provider**: `Optional[Literal['tmx']]`

Provider name.

**warnings**: `Optional[list[Warning_]]`

list of warnings.

**chart**: `Optional[Chart]`

Chart object.

**extra**: `dict[str, Any]`

Extra info.

---
## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**isin**: `str`<br/>
International Securities Identification Number of the bond.

**lei**: `str`<br/>
Legal Entity Identifier of the issuing entity.

**figi**: `str`<br/>
FIGI of the bond.

**cusip**: `str`<br/>
CUSIP of the bond.

**coupon_rate**: `float`<br/>
Coupon rate of the bond.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='tmx' label='tmx'>

**isin**: `str`<br/>
International Securities Identification Number of the bond.

**lei**: `str`<br/>
Legal Entity Identifier of the issuing entity.

**figi**: `str`<br/>
FIGI of the bond.

**cusip**: `str`<br/>
CUSIP of the bond.

**coupon_rate**: `float`<br/>
Coupon rate of the bond.

**ytm**: `float`<br/>
Yield to maturity (YTM) is the rate of return anticipated on a bond if it is held until the maturity date. It takes into account the current market price, par value, coupon rate and time to maturity. It is assumed that all coupons are reinvested at the same rate. Values are returned as a normalized percent.

**price**: `float`<br/>
The last price for the bond.

**highest_price**: `float`<br/>
The highest price for the bond on the last traded date.

**lowest_price**: `float`<br/>
The lowest price for the bond on the last traded date.

**total_trades**: `int`<br/>
Total number of trades on the last traded date.

**last_traded_date**: `date`<br/>
Last traded date of the bond.

**maturity_date**: `date`<br/>
Maturity date of the bond.

**issue_date**: `date`<br/>
Issue date of the bond. This is the date when the bond first accrues interest.

**issuer_name**: `str`<br/>
Name of the issuing entity.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

title: "commercial_paper"
description: "Learn about commercial paper, a form of short-term promissory notes issued  primarily by corporations. Discover how it can help raise cash for current transactions  and serve as a lower-cost alternative to bank loans. Explore the parameters and  data returned by the commercial paper API endpoint."
keywords:
- commercial paper
- short-term promissory notes
- corporations
- raise cash
- lower-cost alternative
- start_date
- end_date
- maturity
- category
- grade
- provider
- results

import HeadTitle from '@site/src/components/General/HeadTitle.tsx';

<HeadTitle title="fixedincome/corporate/commercial_paper - Reference | OpenBB Docs" />

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

Commercial Paper.

Commercial paper (CP) consists of short-term, promissory notes issued primarily by corporations.
Maturities range up to 270 days but average about 30 days.
Many companies use CP to raise cash needed for current transactions,
and many find it to be a lower-cost alternative to bank loans.


Examples
--------

```python
from openbb import obb
obb.fixedincome.corporate.commercial_paper(provider='fred')
obb.fixedincome.corporate.commercial_paper(category=all, maturity=15d, provider='fred')
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**maturity**: `Union[Union[str, Literal['all', 'overnight', '7d', '15d', '30d', '60d', '90d']], list[Union[str, Literal['all', 'overnight', '7d', '15d', '30d', '60d', '90d']]]]`<br/>
*Default:* all<br/>
A target maturity. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): fred.

**category**: `Union[Union[str, Literal['all', 'asset_backed', 'financial', 'nonfinancial', 'a2p2']], list[Union[str, Literal['all', 'asset_backed', 'financial', 'nonfinancial', 'a2p2']]]]`<br/>
*Default:* all<br/>
The category of asset. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): fred.

**frequency**: `Literal['a', 'q', 'm', 'w', 'wef', 'weth', 'wew', 'wetu', 'wem', 'wesu', 'wesa', 'bwew', 'bwem']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

Frequency aggregation to convert daily data to lower frequency.<br/>
            a = Annual<br/>
            q = Quarterly<br/>
            m = Monthly<br/>
            w = Weekly<br/>
            wef = Weekly, Ending Friday<br/>
            weth = Weekly, Ending Thursday<br/>
            wew = Weekly, Ending Wednesday<br/>
            wetu = Weekly, Ending Tuesday<br/>
            wem = Weekly, Ending Monday<br/>
            wesu = Weekly, Ending Sunday<br/>
            wesa = Weekly, Ending Saturday<br/>
            bwew = Biweekly, Ending Wednesday<br/>
            bwem = Biweekly, Ending Monday<br/>
</details>

**aggregation_method**: `Literal['avg', 'sum', 'eop']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

A key that indicates the aggregation method used for frequency aggregation.<br/>
            avg = Average<br/>
            sum = Sum<br/>
            eop = End of Period<br/>
</details>

**transform**: `Literal['chg', 'ch1', 'pch', 'pc1', 'pca', 'cch', 'cca', 'log']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

Transformation type<br/>
            None = No transformation<br/>
            chg = Change<br/>
            ch1 = Change from Year Ago<br/>
            pch = Percent Change<br/>
            pc1 = Percent Change from Year Ago<br/>
            pca = Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
            cch = Continuously Compounded Rate of Change<br/>
            cca = Continuously Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
            log = Natural Log<br/>
</details>

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

Maturity length of the item.

Interest rate.

Title of the series.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**symbol**: `str`<br/>
Symbol representing the entity requested in the data.

**maturity**: `str`<br/>
Maturity length of the item.

**rate**: `float`<br/>
Interest rate.

**title**: `str`<br/>
Title of the series.

The category of asset.

title: "hqm"
description: "Learn about the HQM yield curve and the high quality corporate bond market.  Get information on AAA, AA, and A bonds, market-weighted average quality, corporate  bond rates, maturity, yield curve type, provider, and data."
keywords:
- HQM yield curve
- high quality corporate bond market
- AAA bonds
- AA bonds
- A bonds
- market-weighted average quality
- corporate bond rates
- maturity
- yield curve type
- provider
- fred
- data
---

import HeadTitle from '@site/src/components/General/HeadTitle.tsx';

<HeadTitle title="fixedincome/corporate/hqm - Reference | OpenBB Docs" />

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

High Quality Market Corporate Bond.

The HQM yield curve represents the high quality corporate bond market, i.e.,
corporate bonds rated AAA, AA, or A.  The HQM curve contains two regression terms.
These terms are adjustment factors that blend AAA, AA, and A bonds into a single HQM yield curve
that is the market-weighted average (MWA) quality of high quality bonds.


Examples
--------

```python
from openbb import obb
obb.fixedincome.corporate.hqm(provider='fred')
obb.fixedincome.corporate.hqm(yield_curve=par, provider='fred')
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**date**: `Union[date | str, list[date | str]]`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): fred.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**date**: `Union[date | str, list[date | str]]`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): fred.

**yield_curve**: `Literal['spot', 'par']`<br/>
*Default:* spot<br/>
The yield curve type.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

---

## Returns

**results**: `list[HighQualityMarketCorporateBond]`

Serializable results.

**provider**: `Optional[Literal['fred']]`

Provider name.

**warnings**: `Optional[list[Warning_]]`

list of warnings.

**chart**: `Optional[Chart]`

Chart object.

**extra**: `dict[str, Any]`

Extra info.

---

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

Interest rate.

**maturity**: `str`<br/>
Maturity.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

Interest rate.

**maturity**: `str`<br/>

title: "spot_rates"
description: "Learn about spot rates and how they are used to calculate the yield on  a bond. Understand the concept of discounting and its application in evaluating  pension liabilities. Explore the parameters needed to query and retrieve spot rate  data. Get the serializable results, provider information, warnings, chart, and metadata  associated with the query. Access the spot rate data including the date and rate."

import HeadTitle from '@site/src/components/General/HeadTitle.tsx';

<HeadTitle title="fixedincome/corporate/spot_rates - Reference | OpenBB Docs" />

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

Spot Rates.

The spot rates for any maturity is the yield on a bond that provides a single payment at that maturity.
This is a zero coupon bond.
Because each spot rate pertains to a single cashflow, it is the relevant interest rate
concept for discounting a pension liability at the same maturity.


Examples
--------

```python
from openbb import obb
obb.fixedincome.corporate.spot_rates(provider='fred')
obb.fixedincome.corporate.spot_rates(maturity='10,20,30,50', provider='fred')
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**maturity**: `Union[Union[float, str], list[Union[float, str]]]`<br/>
*Default:* 10.0<br/>
Maturities in years. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): fred.

**category**: `str | list[str]`<br/>
*Default:* spot_rate<br/>
Rate category. Options: spot_rate, par_yield. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): fred.

<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Choices</summary>

- par_yield
- spot_rate
</details>

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**maturity**: `Union[Union[float, str], list[Union[float, str]]]`<br/>
*Default:* 10.0<br/>
Maturities in years. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): fred.

**category**: `str | list[str]`<br/>
*Default:* spot_rate<br/>
Rate category. Options: spot_rate, par_yield. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): fred.

<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Choices</summary>

- par_yield
- spot_rate
</details>

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

---

## Returns

**results**: `list[SpotRate]`

Serializable results.

**provider**: `Optional[Literal['fred']]`

Provider name.

**warnings**: `Optional[list[Warning_]]`

list of warnings.

Chart object.

**extra**: `dict[str, Any]`

Extra info.

</TabItem>

title: "tips_yields"
description: "Get current Treasury inflation-protected securities yields"
keywords:

import HeadTitle from '@site/src/components/General/HeadTitle.tsx';

<HeadTitle title="fixedincome/government/tips_yields - Reference | OpenBB Docs" />

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

Get current Treasury inflation-protected securities yields.


Examples
--------

```python
from openbb import obb
obb.fixedincome.government.tips_yields(provider='fred')
obb.fixedincome.government.tips_yields(maturity=10, provider='fred')
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**maturity**: `Literal['5', '10', '20', '30']`<br/>
The maturity of the security in years - 5, 10, 20, 30 - defaults to all. Note that the maturity is the tenor of the security, not the time to maturity.

**frequency**: `Literal['a', 'q', 'm', 'w', 'd', 'wef', 'weth', 'wew', 'wetu', 'wem', 'wesu', 'wesa', 'bwew', 'bwem']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

Frequency aggregation to convert high frequency data to lower frequency.<br/>
            None = No change<br/>
            a = Annual<br/>
            q = Quarterly<br/>
            m = Monthly<br/>
            w = Weekly<br/>
            d = Daily<br/>
            wef = Weekly, Ending Friday<br/>
            weth = Weekly, Ending Thursday<br/>
            wew = Weekly, Ending Wednesday<br/>
            wetu = Weekly, Ending Tuesday<br/>
            wem = Weekly, Ending Monday<br/>
            wesu = Weekly, Ending Sunday<br/>
            wesa = Weekly, Ending Saturday<br/>
            bwew = Biweekly, Ending Wednesday<br/>
            bwem = Biweekly, Ending Monday<br/>
</details>

**aggregation_method**: `Literal['avg', 'sum', 'eop']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

A key that indicates the aggregation method used for frequency aggregation.<br/>
            avg = Average<br/>
            sum = Sum<br/>
            eop = End of Period<br/>
</details>

**transform**: `Literal['chg', 'ch1', 'pch', 'pc1', 'pca', 'cch', 'cca']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

Transformation type<br/>
            None = No transformation<br/>
            chg = Change<br/>
            ch1 = Change from Year Ago<br/>
            pch = Percent Change<br/>
            pc1 = Percent Change from Year Ago<br/>
            pca = Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
            cch = Continuously Compounded Rate of Change<br/>
            cca = Continuously Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
</details>

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

---

## Returns

**results**: `list[TipsYields]`

Serializable results.

**provider**: `Optional[Literal['fred']]`

Provider name.

**warnings**: `Optional[list[Warning_]]`

list of warnings.

**chart**: `Optional[Chart]`

Chart object.

**extra**: `dict[str, Any]`

Extra info.

---
## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**symbol**: `str`<br/>
Symbol representing the entity requested in the data.

**due**: `date`<br/>
The due date (maturation date) of the security.

**name**: `str`<br/>
The name of the security.

**value**: `float`<br/>
The yield value.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

Symbol representing the entity requested in the data.

**due**: `date`<br/>
The due date (maturation date) of the security.

The name of the security.

The yield value.

</TabItem>

title: "treasury_auctions"
description: "Government Treasury Auctions"
keywords:
- fixedincome

---

import HeadTitle from '@site/src/components/General/HeadTitle.tsx';

<HeadTitle title="fixedincome/government/treasury_auctions - Reference | OpenBB Docs" />

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

Government Treasury Auctions.


Examples
--------

```python
from openbb import obb
obb.fixedincome.government.treasury_auctions(provider='government_us')
obb.fixedincome.government.treasury_auctions(security_type='Bill', start_date='2022-01-01', end_date='2023-01-01', provider='government_us')
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**security_type**: `Literal['bill', 'note', 'bond', 'cmb', 'tips', 'frn']`<br/>
Used to only return securities of a particular type.

**cusip**: `str`<br/>
Filter securities by CUSIP.

**page_size**: `int`<br/>
Maximum number of results to return; you must also include pagenum when using pagesize.

**page_num**: `int`<br/>
The first page number to display results for; used in combination with page size.

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is 90 days ago.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is today.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='government_us' label='government_us'>

**security_type**: `Literal['bill', 'note', 'bond', 'cmb', 'tips', 'frn']`<br/>
Used to only return securities of a particular type.

**cusip**: `str`<br/>
Filter securities by CUSIP.

**page_size**: `int`<br/>
Maximum number of results to return; you must also include pagenum when using pagesize.

**page_num**: `int`<br/>
The first page number to display results for; used in combination with page size.

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is 90 days ago.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format. The default is today.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

---

## Returns

**results**: `list[TreasuryAuctions]`

Serializable results.

**provider**: `Optional[Literal['government_us']]`

Provider name.

**warnings**: `Optional[list[Warning_]]`

list of warnings.

**chart**: `Optional[Chart]`

Chart object.

**extra**: `dict[str, Any]`

Extra info.

---
## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**cusip**: `str`<br/>
CUSIP of the Security.

**issue_date**: `date`<br/>
The issue date of the security.

**security_type**: `Literal['Bill', 'Note', 'Bond', 'CMB', 'TIPS', 'FRN']`<br/>
The type of security.

**security_term**: `str`<br/>
The term of the security.

**maturity_date**: `date`<br/>
The maturity date of the security.

**interest_rate**: `float`<br/>
The interest rate of the security.

**cpi_on_issue_date**: `float`<br/>
Reference CPI rate on the issue date of the security.

**cpi_on_dated_date**: `float`<br/>
Reference CPI rate on the dated date of the security.

**announcement_date**: `date`<br/>
The announcement date of the security.

**auction_date**: `date`<br/>
The auction date of the security.

**auction_date_year**: `int`<br/>
The auction date year of the security.

**dated_date**: `date`<br/>
The dated date of the security.

**first_payment_date**: `date`<br/>
The first payment date of the security.

**accrued_interest_per_100**: `float`<br/>
Accrued interest per $100.

**accrued_interest_per_1000**: `float`<br/>
Accrued interest per $1000.

**adjusted_accrued_interest_per_100**: `float`<br/>
Adjusted accrued interest per $100.

**adjusted_accrued_interest_per_1000**: `float`<br/>
Adjusted accrued interest per $1000.

**adjusted_price**: `float`<br/>
Adjusted price.

**allocation_percentage**: `float`<br/>
Allocation percentage, as normalized percentage points.

**allocation_percentage_decimals**: `float`<br/>
The number of decimals in the Allocation percentage.

**announced_cusip**: `str`<br/>
The announced CUSIP of the security.

**auction_format**: `str`<br/>
The auction format of the security.

**avg_median_discount_rate**: `float`<br/>
The average median discount rate of the security.

**avg_median_investment_rate**: `float`<br/>
The average median investment rate of the security.

**avg_median_price**: `float`<br/>
The average median price paid for the security.

**avg_median_discount_margin**: `float`<br/>
The average median discount margin of the security.

**avg_median_yield**: `float`<br/>
The average median yield of the security.

**back_dated**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether the security is back dated.

**back_dated_date**: `date`<br/>
The back dated date of the security.

**bid_to_cover_ratio**: `float`<br/>
The bid to cover ratio of the security.

**call_date**: `date`<br/>
The call date of the security.

**callable**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether the security is callable.

**called_date**: `date`<br/>
The called date of the security.

**cash_management_bill**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether the security is a cash management bill.

**closing_time_competitive**: `str`<br/>
The closing time for competitive bids on the security.

**closing_time_non_competitive**: `str`<br/>
The closing time for non-competitive bids on the security.

**competitive_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The accepted value for competitive bids on the security.

**competitive_accepted_decimals**: `int`<br/>
The number of decimals in the Competitive Accepted.

**competitive_tendered**: `int`<br/>
The tendered value for competitive bids on the security.

**competitive_tenders_accepted**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether competitive tenders are accepted on the security.

**corp_us_cusip**: `str`<br/>
The CUSIP of the security.

**cpi_base_reference_period**: `str`<br/>
The CPI base reference period of the security.

**currently_outstanding**: `int`<br/>
The currently outstanding value on the security.

**direct_bidder_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The accepted value from direct bidders on the security.

**direct_bidder_tendered**: `int`<br/>
The tendered value from direct bidders on the security.

**est_amount_of_publicly_held_maturing_security**: `int`<br/>
The estimated amount of publicly held maturing securities on the security.

**fima_included**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether the security is included in the FIMA (Foreign and International Money Authorities).

**fima_non_competitive_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The non-competitive accepted value on the security from FIMAs.

**fima_non_competitive_tendered**: `int`<br/>
The non-competitive tendered value on the security from FIMAs.

**first_interest_period**: `str`<br/>
The first interest period of the security.

**first_interest_payment_date**: `date`<br/>
The first interest payment date of the security.

**floating_rate**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether the security is a floating rate.

**frn_index_determination_date**: `date`<br/>
The FRN index determination date of the security.

**frn_index_determination_rate**: `float`<br/>
The FRN index determination rate of the security.

**high_discount_rate**: `float`<br/>
The high discount rate of the security.

**high_investment_rate**: `float`<br/>
The high investment rate of the security.

**high_price**: `float`<br/>
The high price of the security at auction.

**high_discount_margin**: `float`<br/>
The high discount margin of the security.

**high_yield**: `float`<br/>
The high yield of the security at auction.

**index_ratio_on_issue_date**: `float`<br/>
The index ratio on the issue date of the security.

**indirect_bidder_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The accepted value from indirect bidders on the security.

**indirect_bidder_tendered**: `int`<br/>
The tendered value from indirect bidders on the security.

**interest_payment_frequency**: `str`<br/>
The interest payment frequency of the security.

**low_discount_rate**: `float`<br/>
The low discount rate of the security.

**low_investment_rate**: `float`<br/>
The low investment rate of the security.

**low_price**: `float`<br/>
The low price of the security at auction.

**low_discount_margin**: `float`<br/>
The low discount margin of the security.

**low_yield**: `float`<br/>
The low yield of the security at auction.

**maturing_date**: `date`<br/>
The maturing date of the security.

**max_competitive_award**: `int`<br/>
The maximum competitive award at auction.

**max_non_competitive_award**: `int`<br/>
The maximum non-competitive award at auction.

**max_single_bid**: `int`<br/>
The maximum single bid at auction.

**min_bid_amount**: `int`<br/>
The minimum bid amount at auction.

**min_strip_amount**: `int`<br/>
The minimum strip amount at auction.

**min_to_issue**: `int`<br/>
The minimum to issue at auction.

**multiples_to_bid**: `int`<br/>
The multiples to bid at auction.

**multiples_to_issue**: `int`<br/>
The multiples to issue at auction.

**nlp_exclusion_amount**: `int`<br/>
The NLP exclusion amount at auction.

**nlp_reporting_threshold**: `int`<br/>
The NLP reporting threshold at auction.

**non_competitive_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The accepted value from non-competitive bidders on the security.

**non_competitive_tenders_accepted**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether or not the auction accepted non-competitive tenders.

**offering_amount**: `int`<br/>
The offering amount at auction.

**original_cusip**: `str`<br/>
The original CUSIP of the security.

**original_dated_date**: `date`<br/>
The original dated date of the security.

**original_issue_date**: `date`<br/>
The original issue date of the security.

**original_security_term**: `str`<br/>
The original term of the security.

**pdf_announcement**: `str`<br/>
The PDF filename for the announcement of the security.

**pdf_competitive_results**: `str`<br/>
The PDF filename for the competitive results of the security.

**pdf_non_competitive_results**: `str`<br/>
The PDF filename for the non-competitive results of the security.

**pdf_special_announcement**: `str`<br/>
The PDF filename for the special announcements.

**price_per_100**: `float`<br/>
The price per 100 of the security.

**primary_dealer_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The primary dealer accepted value on the security.

**primary_dealer_tendered**: `int`<br/>
The primary dealer tendered value on the security.

**reopening**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether or not the auction was reopened.

**security_term_day_month**: `str`<br/>
The security term in days or months.

**security_term_week_year**: `str`<br/>
The security term in weeks or years.

**series**: `str`<br/>
The series name of the security.

**soma_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The SOMA accepted value on the security.

**soma_holdings**: `int`<br/>
The SOMA holdings on the security.

**soma_included**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether or not the SOMA (System Open Market Account) was included on the security.

**soma_tendered**: `int`<br/>
The SOMA tendered value on the security.

**spread**: `float`<br/>
The spread on the security.

**standard_payment_per_1000**: `float`<br/>
The standard payment per 1000 of the security.

**strippable**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether or not the security is strippable.

**term**: `str`<br/>
The term of the security.

**tiin_conversion_factor_per_1000**: `float`<br/>
The TIIN conversion factor per 1000 of the security.

**tips**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether or not the security is TIPS.

**total_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The total accepted value at auction.

**total_tendered**: `int`<br/>
The total tendered value at auction.

**treasury_retail_accepted**: `int`<br/>
The accepted value on the security from retail.

**treasury_retail_tenders_accepted**: `Literal['Yes', 'No']`<br/>
Whether or not the tender offers from retail are accepted

**type**: `str`<br/>
The type of issuance.  This might be different than the security type.

**unadjusted_accrued_interest_per_1000**: `float`<br/>
The unadjusted accrued interest per 1000 of the security.

**unadjusted_price**: `float`<br/>
The unadjusted price of the security.

**updated_timestamp**: `datetime`<br/>
The updated timestamp of the security.

**xml_announcement**: `str`<br/>
The XML filename for the announcement of the security.

**xml_competitive_results**: `str`<br/>
The XML filename for the competitive results of the security.

**xml_special_announcement**: `str`<br/>
The XML filename for special announcements.

**tint_cusip1**: `str`<br/>
Tint CUSIP 1.

**tint_cusip2**: `str`<br/>
Tint CUSIP 2.

</TabItem>

---
title: "treasury_prices"
description: "Government Treasury Prices by date"
keywords:
- fixedincome
- government
- treasury_prices
---

import HeadTitle from '@site/src/components/General/HeadTitle.tsx';

<HeadTitle title="fixedincome/government/treasury_prices - Reference | OpenBB Docs" />

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

Government Treasury Prices by date.


Examples
--------

```python
from openbb import obb
obb.fixedincome.government.treasury_prices(provider='government_us')
obb.fixedincome.government.treasury_prices(date='2019-02-05', provider='government_us')
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. Defaults to the last business day.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='government_us' label='government_us'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. Defaults to the last business day.

**cusip**: `str`<br/>
Filter by CUSIP.

**security_type**: `Literal['bill', 'note', 'bond', 'tips', 'frn']`<br/>
Filter by security type.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='tmx' label='tmx'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. Defaults to the last business day.

**govt_type**: `Literal['federal', 'provincial', 'municipal']`<br/>
*Default:* federal<br/>
The level of government issuer.

**issue_date_min**: `date`<br/>
Filter by the minimum original issue date.

**issue_date_max**: `date`<br/>
Filter by the maximum original issue date.

**last_traded_min**: `date`<br/>
Filter by the minimum last trade date.

**maturity_date_min**: `date`<br/>
Filter by the minimum maturity date.

**maturity_date_max**: `date`<br/>
Filter by the maximum maturity date.

**use_cache**: `bool`<br/>
*Default:* True<br/>
All bond data is sourced from a single JSON file that is updated daily. The file is cached for one day to eliminate downloading more than once. Caching will significantly speed up subsequent queries. To bypass, set to False.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

---

## Returns

**results**: `list[TreasuryPrices]`

Serializable results.

**provider**: `Optional[Literal['government_us', 'tmx']]`

Provider name.

**warnings**: `Optional[list[Warning_]]`

list of warnings.

**chart**: `Optional[Chart]`

Chart object.

**extra**: `dict[str, Any]`

Extra info.

---
## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**issuer_name**: `str`<br/>
Name of the issuing entity.

**cusip**: `str`<br/>
CUSIP of the security.

**isin**: `str`<br/>
ISIN of the security.

**security_type**: `str`<br/>
The type of Treasury security - i.e., Bill, Note, Bond, TIPS, FRN.

**issue_date**: `date`<br/>
The original issue date of the security.

**maturity_date**: `date`<br/>
The maturity date of the security.

**call_date**: `date`<br/>
The call date of the security.

**bid**: `float`<br/>
The bid price of the security.

**offer**: `float`<br/>
The offer price of the security.

**eod_price**: `float`<br/>
The end-of-day price of the security.

**last_traded_date**: `date`<br/>
The last trade date of the security.

**total_trades**: `int`<br/>
Total number of trades on the last traded date.

**last_price**: `float`<br/>
The last price of the security.

**highest_price**: `float`<br/>
The highest price for the bond on the last traded date.

**lowest_price**: `float`<br/>
The lowest price for the bond on the last traded date.

**rate**: `float`<br/>
The annualized interest rate or coupon of the security.

**ytm**: `float`<br/>
Yield to maturity (YTM) is the rate of return anticipated on a bond if it is held until the maturity date. It takes into account the current market price, par value, coupon rate and time to maturity. It is assumed that all coupons are reinvested at the same rate.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='government_us' label='government_us'>

**issuer_name**: `str`<br/>
Name of the issuing entity.

**cusip**: `str`<br/>
CUSIP of the security.

**isin**: `str`<br/>
ISIN of the security.

**security_type**: `str`<br/>
The type of Treasury security - i.e., Bill, Note, Bond, TIPS, FRN.

**issue_date**: `date`<br/>
The original issue date of the security.

**maturity_date**: `date`<br/>
The maturity date of the security.

**call_date**: `date`<br/>
The call date of the security.

**bid**: `float`<br/>
The bid price of the security.

**offer**: `float`<br/>
The offer price of the security.

**eod_price**: `float`<br/>
The end-of-day price of the security.

**last_traded_date**: `date`<br/>
The last trade date of the security.

**total_trades**: `int`<br/>
Total number of trades on the last traded date.

**last_price**: `float`<br/>
The last price of the security.

**highest_price**: `float`<br/>
The highest price for the bond on the last traded date.

**lowest_price**: `float`<br/>
The lowest price for the bond on the last traded date.

**rate**: `float`<br/>
The annualized interest rate or coupon of the security.

**ytm**: `float`<br/>
Yield to maturity (YTM) is the rate of return anticipated on a bond if it is held until the maturity date. It takes into account the current market price, par value, coupon rate and time to maturity. It is assumed that all coupons are reinvested at the same rate.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='tmx' label='tmx'>

**issuer_name**: `str`<br/>
Name of the issuing entity.

**cusip**: `str`<br/>
CUSIP of the security.

**isin**: `str`<br/>
ISIN of the security.

**security_type**: `str`<br/>
The type of Treasury security - i.e., Bill, Note, Bond, TIPS, FRN.

**issue_date**: `date`<br/>
The original issue date of the security.

**maturity_date**: `date`<br/>
The maturity date of the security.

**call_date**: `date`<br/>
The call date of the security.

**bid**: `float`<br/>
The bid price of the security.

**offer**: `float`<br/>
The offer price of the security.

**eod_price**: `float`<br/>
The end-of-day price of the security.

The last trade date of the security.

Total number of trades on the last traded date.

**last_price**: `float`<br/>
The last price of the security.

**highest_price**: `float`<br/>
The highest price for the bond on the last traded date.

**lowest_price**: `float`<br/>
The lowest price for the bond on the last traded date.

**rate**: `float`<br/>
The annualized interest rate or coupon of the security.

**ytm**: `float`<br/>
Yield to maturity (YTM) is the rate of return anticipated on a bond if it is held until the maturity date. It takes into account the current market price, par value, coupon rate and time to maturity. It is assumed that all coupons are reinvested at the same rate.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

---
title: "yield_curve"
description: "Get yield curve data by country and date"
keywords:
- fixedincome
- government
- yield_curve
---

import HeadTitle from '@site/src/components/General/HeadTitle.tsx';

<HeadTitle title="fixedincome/government/yield_curve - Reference | OpenBB Docs" />

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

Get yield curve data by country and date.


Examples
--------

```python
from openbb import obb
obb.fixedincome.government.yield_curve(provider='federal_reserve')
obb.fixedincome.government.yield_curve(date='2023-05-01,2024-05-01', provider='fmp')
obb.fixedincome.government.yield_curve(date='2023-05-01', country=united_kingdom, provider='econdb')
obb.fixedincome.government.yield_curve(provider='ecb', yield_curve_type=par_yield)
obb.fixedincome.government.yield_curve(provider='fred', yield_curve_type=real, date='2023-05-01,2024-05-01')
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**date**: `Union[date | str, list[date | str]]`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. By default is the current data. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): ecb, econdb, federal_reserve, fmp, fred.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='ecb' label='ecb'>

**date**: `Union[date | str, list[date | str]]`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. By default is the current data. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): ecb, econdb, federal_reserve, fmp, fred.

**rating**: `Literal['aaa', 'all_ratings']`<br/>
*Default:* aaa<br/>
The rating type, either 'aaa' or 'all_ratings'.

**yield_curve_type**: `Literal['spot_rate', 'instantaneous_forward', 'par_yield']`<br/>
*Default:* spot_rate<br/>
The yield curve type.

**use_cache**: `bool`<br/>
*Default:* True<br/>
If true, cache the request for four hours.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='econdb' label='econdb'>

**date**: `Union[date | str, list[date | str]]`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. By default is the current data. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): ecb, econdb, federal_reserve, fmp, fred.

**country**: `str | list[str]`<br/>
*Default:* united_states<br/>
The country to get data. New Zealand, Mexico, Singapore, and Thailand have only monthly data. The nearest date to the requested one will be used. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): econdb.

<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Choices</summary>

- australia
- canada
- china
- ecb_instantaneous_forward
- ecb_par_yield
- ecb_spot_rate
- hong_kong
- india
- japan
- mexico
- new_zealand
- russia
- saudi_arabia
- singapore
- south_africa
- south_korea
- taiwan
- thailand
- united_kingdom
- united_states
</details>

**use_cache**: `bool`<br/>
*Default:* True<br/>
If true, cache the request for four hours.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='federal_reserve' label='federal_reserve'>

**date**: `Union[date | str, list[date | str]]`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. By default is the current data. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): ecb, econdb, federal_reserve, fmp, fred.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fmp' label='fmp'>

**date**: `Union[date | str, list[date | str]]`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. By default is the current data. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): ecb, econdb, federal_reserve, fmp, fred.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**date**: `Union[date | str, list[date | str]]`<br/>
A specific date to get data for. By default is the current data. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): ecb, econdb, federal_reserve, fmp, fred.

**yield_curve_type**: `Literal['nominal', 'real', 'breakeven', 'treasury_minus_fed_funds', 'corporate_spot', 'corporate_par']`<br/>
*Default:* nominal<br/>
Yield curve type. Nominal and Real Rates are available daily, others are monthly. The closest date to the requested date will be returned.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

---

## Returns

**results**: `list[YieldCurve]`

Serializable results.

**provider**: `Optional[Literal['ecb', 'econdb', 'federal_reserve', 'fmp', 'fred']]`

Provider name.

**warnings**: `Optional[list[Warning_]]`

list of warnings.

**chart**: `Optional[Chart]`

Chart object.

**extra**: `dict[str, Any]`

Extra info.

---

<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**maturity**: `str`<br/>
Maturity length of the security.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='ecb' label='ecb'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**maturity**: `str`<br/>
Maturity length of the security.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='econdb' label='econdb'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**maturity**: `str`<br/>
Maturity length of the security.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='federal_reserve' label='federal_reserve'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**maturity**: `str`<br/>
Maturity length of the security.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fmp' label='fmp'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**maturity**: `str`<br/>
Maturity length of the security.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**maturity**: `str`<br/>
Maturity length of the security.

---
title: "mortgage_indices"
description: "Mortgage Indices"
keywords:
- fixedincome
- mortgage_indices
---

import HeadTitle from '@site/src/components/General/HeadTitle.tsx';

<HeadTitle title="fixedincome/mortgage_indices - Reference | OpenBB Docs" />

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD012 MD031 MD033 -->

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

Mortgage Indices.


Examples
--------

```python
from openbb import obb
# The default state for FRED are the primary mortgage indices from Optimal Blue.
obb.fixedincome.mortgage_indices(provider='fred')
# Multiple indices can be requested.
obb.fixedincome.mortgage_indices(index=jumbo_30y,conforming_30y,conforming_15y, provider='fred')
```

## Parameters

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**start_date**: `date | str`<br/>
Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**end_date**: `date | str`<br/>
End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

**index**: `Union[Union[Literal['primary', 'ltv_lte_80', 'ltv_gt_80', 'conforming_30y', 'conforming_30y_na', 'jumbo_30y', 'fha_30y', 'va_30y', 'usda_30y', 'conforming_15y', 'ltv_lte80_fico_ge740', 'ltv_lte80_fico_a720b739', 'ltv_lte80_fico_a700b719', 'ltv_lte80_fico_a680b699', 'ltv_lte80_fico_lt680', 'ltv_gt80_fico_ge740', 'ltv_gt80_fico_a720b739', 'ltv_gt80_fico_a700b719', 'ltv_gt80_fico_a680b699', 'ltv_gt80_fico_lt680'], str], list[Union[Literal['primary', 'ltv_lte_80', 'ltv_gt_80', 'conforming_30y', 'conforming_30y_na', 'jumbo_30y', 'fha_30y', 'va_30y', 'usda_30y', 'conforming_15y', 'ltv_lte80_fico_ge740', 'ltv_lte80_fico_a720b739', 'ltv_lte80_fico_a700b719', 'ltv_lte80_fico_a680b699', 'ltv_lte80_fico_lt680', 'ltv_gt80_fico_ge740', 'ltv_gt80_fico_a720b739', 'ltv_gt80_fico_a700b719', 'ltv_gt80_fico_a680b699', 'ltv_gt80_fico_lt680'], str]]]`<br/>
*Default:* primary<br/>
The specific index, or index group, to query. Default is the 'primary' group. Multiple items allowed for provider(s): fred.

**frequency**: `Literal['a', 'q', 'm', 'w', 'd', 'wef', 'weth', 'wew', 'wetu', 'wem', 'wesu', 'wesa', 'bwew', 'bwem']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

Frequency aggregation to convert daily data to lower frequency.<br/>
            None = No change<br/>
            a = Annual<br/>
            q = Quarterly<br/>
            m = Monthly<br/>
            w = Weekly<br/>
            d = Daily<br/>
            wef = Weekly, Ending Friday<br/>
            weth = Weekly, Ending Thursday<br/>
            wew = Weekly, Ending Wednesday<br/>
            wetu = Weekly, Ending Tuesday<br/>
            wem = Weekly, Ending Monday<br/>
            wesu = Weekly, Ending Sunday<br/>
            wesa = Weekly, Ending Saturday<br/>
            bwew = Biweekly, Ending Wednesday<br/>
            bwem = Biweekly, Ending Monday<br/>
</details>

**aggregation_method**: `Literal['avg', 'sum', 'eop']`<br/>
*Default:* avg<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

A key that indicates the aggregation method used for frequency aggregation.<br/>
        This parameter has no affect if the frequency parameter is not set, default is 'avg'.<br/>
            avg = Average<br/>
            sum = Sum<br/>
            eop = End of Period<br/>
</details>

**transform**: `Literal['chg', 'ch1', 'pch', 'pc1', 'pca', 'cch', 'cca', 'log']`<br/>
<details>
<summary mdxType="summary">Description</summary>

Transformation type<br/>
            None = No transformation<br/>
            chg = Change<br/>
            ch1 = Change from Year Ago<br/>
            pch = Percent Change<br/>
            pc1 = Percent Change from Year Ago<br/>
            pca = Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
            cch = Continuously Compounded Rate of Change<br/>
            cca = Continuously Compounded Annual Rate of Change<br/>
            log = Natural Log<br/>
</details>

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

---

## Returns

**results**: `list[MortgageIndices]`

Serializable results.

**provider**: `Optional[Literal['fred']]`

Provider name.

**warnings**: `Optional[list[Warning_]]`

list of warnings.

**chart**: `Optional[Chart]`

Chart object.

**extra**: `dict[str, Any]`

Extra info.

---
## Data

<Tabs>
<TabItem value='standard' label='standard'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**symbol**: `str`<br/>
Symbol representing the entity requested in the data.

**name**: `str`<br/>
Name of the index.

**rate**: `float`<br/>
Mortgage rate.

</TabItem>
<TabItem value='fred' label='fred'>

**date**: `date | str`<br/>
The date of the data.

**symbol**: `str`<br/>
Symbol representing the entity requested in the data.

**name**: `str`<br/>
Name of the index.

**rate**: `float`<br/>
Mortgage rate.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>
